en: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
hmr: A tîrin thu a um, Thu chu Pathien kuomah a um, Thu chu Pathien a nih.

en: The same was in the beginning with God.
hmr: Chu chu a tîrin Pathien kuomah a um.

en: All things were made through him; and without him was not anything made that hath been made.
hmr: Iengkim a rêngin ama siem a nih; thil siem po po hi ama siem naw iengkhawm a um nawh.

en: In him was life; and the life was the light of men.
hmr: Amaa chun hringna a um; chu hringna chu mihriemhai var a nih.

en: And the light shineth in the darkness; and the darkness apprehended it not.
hmr: Var chu inthim lai a hung var a, inthimin chu chu a hriet nawh.

en: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.
hmr: Pathien tir mi pakhat a lo um a, a hming chu Johan a nih.

en: The same came for witness, that he might bear witness of the light, that all might believe through him.
hmr: Ama chu inhriettir dingin a hung a, var thu chu inhriettir dingin; ama leia mi po poin an awina dingin.

en: He was not the light, but came that he might bear witness of the light.
hmr: Ama chu var chu a ni nawh, var thu chu inhriettir dinga hung a ni lem.

en: There was the true light, even the light which lighteth every man, coming into the world.
hmr: Var indik tak mi tin sukvar hlak kha a um a, khawvêlah a hung zing a nih.

en: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world knew him not.
hmr: Ama chu khawvêlah a um a, khawvêl ama siem a na, khawvêlin ama a hriet si nawh.

en: He came unto his own, and they that were his own received him not.
hmr: Ama mihai kuomah a hung a, ama mihaiin an lo lâwm si nawh.

en: But as many as received him, to them gave he the right to become children of God, even to them that believe on his name:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama lâwm taphawt chu, an kuomah Pathien nauhai ni theina ding a pêk, a hming ringtuhai chu.

en: who were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
hmr: Chuong mihai chu thisena nei an ni nawh a, tisa dit zâwnga nei an ni bawk nawh a, pasal dit zâwnga nei khawm an ni nawh a, Pathien inei an ni lem.

en: And the Word became flesh, and dwelt among us (and we beheld his glory, glory as of the only begotten from the Father), full of grace and truth.
hmr: Chun, Thu chu tisain a hung inchang a, eini lai a hung um tah a, (Pa nau khât nei ropui angin a ropuizie ei hmuh), lunginsietna le thutakin a sip.

en: John beareth witness of him, and crieth, saying, This was he of whom I said, He that cometh after me is become before me: for he was before me.
hmr: Johan chun a thu ân hriettir a, a khêk a, “ ‘Ka hnunga hung ding chu ka nêka ropui lem a nih, ka um hmaa um ta hrim a ni leiin,’ tia a thu ka hril kha ama hi a nih,” a ta.

en: For of his fulness we all received, and grace for grace.
hmr: A famkimna ei chang seng, lunginsietna chunga lunginsiet nâwksâwnna leh.

en: For the law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
hmr: Dân chu Mosie hmanga pêk a na, lunginsietna le thutak chu Isu Krista leiin a hung um.

en: No man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, who is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.
hmr: Tukhawmin ienglai khawmin Pathien an hmu nawh; a Naupa khât nei sun, Pa ângsûnga um ngei khan a chanchin a hril tah a nih.

en: And this is the witness of John, when the Jews sent unto him from Jerusalem priests and Levites to ask him, Who art thou?
hmr: Chun, Judahaiin, “Tû am i na?” tia indawn dingin Jerusalema inthawkin a kuomah thiempuhai le Levi chia mihai an tir lai khan, hieng hi Johan thu lo inhriettir chu a nih:

en: And he confessed, and denied not; and he confessed, I am not the Christ.
hmr: “Kei chu Krista chu ka ni nawh” tiin inphat loin ân phuong a.

en: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elijah? And he saith, I am not. Art thou the prophet? And he answered, No.
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Tû am i ni leh? Elija i ni?” an ta, an indawn a. Ama chun, “Ka ni nawh,” a ta. “Zâwlnei kha i ni?” an ta, ama chun, “Ni lo e,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: They said therefore unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
hmr: Chun, anni chun a kuomah, “Anleh, tû am i na? a mi tirtuhai kan dawn theina dingin mi hril ta la. I chanchin hrim ieng am i hril ding a na?” an ta.

en: He said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said Isaiah the prophet.
hmr: Ama chun, “ ‘Lalpa lampui suk- ruol ro,’ tia thlalêra khêktu râwl chu ka nih; zâwlnei Isai hril ang khan,” a ta.

en: And they had been sent from the Pharisees.
hmr: Mi tirhai chu Pharisaihai kuoma mi an nih.

en: And they asked him, and said unto him, Why then baptizest thou, if thou art not the Christ, neither Elijah, neither the prophet?
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Krista bêk, Elija bêk, zâwlnei amani bêk i ni si naw chun, iengdinga i baptis hlak am a na?” an ta, an indawn a.

en: John answered them, saying, I baptize in water: in the midst of you standeth one whom ye know not,
hmr: Chun, Johan chun an kuomah, “Keiin tuiin ka baptis hlak, nangni lai in hriet naw mi pakhat a ngîr a nih,

en: even he that cometh after me, the latchet of whose shoe I am not worthy to unloose.
hmr: ama chu ka hnunga hung ding chu a na, a kekawk hrui sût tlâk khawm ka ni nawh,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: These things were done in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
hmr: Chuong thil chu Jordan râla Bethania Johanin a baptisnaa kha thaw an nih.

en: On the morrow he seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold, the Lamb of God, that taketh away the sin of the world!
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Johanin Isu a kuoma hung ding a hmuh a. Chun, a hril a, “En ta u, Pathien Berâmte khawvêl suol fepuitu ding saw!

en: This is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man who is become before me: for he was before me.
hmr: Saw saw a nih, ‘mi pakhat ka nêka ropui lem, ka hnunga hung ding a um, ama chu ka um hmaa um ta hrim a nih,’ ka ti kha.

en: And I knew him not; but that he should be made manifest to Israel, for this cause came I baptizing in water.
hmr: Ama chu ka lo hriet si nawh; nisienlakhawm, Israelhai kuoma a hung inlangna dingin, tuia baptis-in ka hung a nih,” a ta.

en: And John bare witness, saying, I have beheld the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven; and it abode upon him.
hmr: Chun, Johanin a thu ân hriettir a, a hril a, “Thlarau chu vaṭhu angin vâna inthawka ṭum ka hmuh a, a chungah a fu zing a.

en: And I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize in water, he said unto me, Upon whomsoever thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and abiding upon him, the same is he that baptizeth in the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Ama chu ka hriet si nawh a, nisienlakhawm, tuia baptis dinga a mi tirtu khan ka kuomah, ‘Tû chunga khawm Thlarau zu fua, a chunga um zing i hmu chun, ama chu Thlarau Inthienga baptistu ding chu nîng a tih,’ a tih a.

en: And I have seen, and have borne witness that this is the Son of God.
hmr: Chu chu ka hmu tah a, ama hi Pathien Naupa a nih ti kân hriettir tah,” a ta.

en: Again on the morrow John was standing, and two of his disciples;
hmr: Chun, a zîng nâwk chun Johan a ngîr a, a închûktirhai pahni leh;

en: and he looked upon Jesus as he walked, and saith, Behold, the Lamb of God!
hmr: chun, Isu invâk vêl lai chu an en a, “En ta u, Pathien Berâmte saw,” a ta.

en: And the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
hmr: Chun, a închûktirhai pahni chun a thu hril chu an hriet a, Isu an zui tah a.

en: And Jesus turned, and beheld them following, and saith unto them, What seek ye? And they said unto him, Rabbi (which is to say, being interpreted, Teacher), where abidest thou?
hmr: Chun, Isu a nghah a, an hung zui chu a hmuh a, an kuomah, “Ieng am in zawng a?” a ta. Anni chun, “Rabbi, (chu chu inchûktirtu tina a nih), khâwlai am i um a?” an ta.

en: He saith unto them, Come, and ye shall see. They came therefore and saw where he abode; and they abode with him that day: it was about the tenth hour.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Hung unla, hmûng in tih,” a ta. Chuong- chun, an feh a, a umna chu an hmuh a, chu ni chun a kuomah an um zing a; zânbu suong pha vêl a nih.

en: One of the two that heard John speak, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
hmr: Johan thu hril hrea Isu zuihai pahni chu, a pakhat lem chu Andri, Simon Peter unau a nih.

en: He findeth first his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messiah (which is, being interpreted, Christ).
hmr: Ama chun a hmasatakin ama unau Simon a hmuh a, a kuomah “Messie kan hmu tah,” a ta, (chu chu Krista tina a nih.)

en: He brought him unto Jesus. Jesus looked upon him, and said, Thou art Simon the son of John: thou shalt be called Cephas (which is by interpretation, Peter).
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu kuomah a hung ṭhuoi a, Isûn ama chu a lo en a, “Johan naupa Simon i nih, Kipha tîng an ti che,” a ta, (chu chu Peter tina a nih.)

en: On the morrow he was minded to go forth into Galilee, and he findeth Philip: and Jesus saith unto him, Follow me.
hmr: Chun, a zînga chun Isu Galili ramah fe a tum a, Philip a hmuh a, “Mi zui rawh,” a ta.

en: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, of the city of Andrew and Peter.
hmr: Philip chu Bethsaida khuoa mi a nih, chu chu Andri le Peter umna khuo bawk a nih.

en: Philip findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, wrote, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
hmr: Philip chun Nathanael a hmuh a, a kuomah, “A chanchin Mosiein Dân lekhabua a ziek le, zâwlneihaiin an ziek kha, ama chu kan hmu tah, Nazareth Isu, Josef naupa chu,” a ta.

en: And Nathanael said unto him, Can any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.
hmr: Chun, Nathanael chun a kuomah, “Nazareth khuoah thil ṭha a suok thei am a nih?” a ta. Philip chun a kuomah, “Hung la, en rawh,” a ta.

en: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom is no guile!
hmr: Isûn Nathanael a kuoma hung ding chu a hmuh a, a chanchin a lo hril a, “En ta u, Israel mi tak, rîtlona hrim hrim nei lo saw,” a ta.

en: Nathanael saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before Philip called thee, when thou wast under the fig tree, I saw thee.
hmr: Nathanael chun a kuomah, “Nangin iengtin am i mi hriet a?” a ta. Isûn a kuomah, “Philipin a ko hma cheh a, theichang bula i um lai khan ka hmu che annâwm,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Nathanael answered him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art King of Israel.
hmr: Nathanaelin a kuomah, “Rabbi, Pathien Naupa i nih, Israelhai Laltak i nih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: Jesus answered and said unto him, Because I said unto thee, I saw thee underneath the fig tree, believest thou? thou shalt see greater things than these.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “ ‘Theichang bulah ka hmu che,’ i kuoma ka ti leiin i ring a ni maw? Hieng nêka thil ropui lem la hmûng i tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: And he saith unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto you, Ye shall see the heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of man.
hmr: Chun, Isu bawkin a kuomah, “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, vân inhawngah, Pathien vântir- kohai Mihriem Naupa chunga hin a lâwn le a ṭum la hmûng in tih,” a ta.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that entereth not by the door into the fold of the sheep, but climbeth up some other way, the same is a thief and a robber.
hmr: “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, tûkhawm berâm huona kawtkhâra lût loa, a dang tienga lâwn lût chu ama chu iengkhat inruhmang le suomhmang a nih.

en: But he that entereth in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.
hmr: Tûkhawm kawtkhâra lût ruok chu, berâm vêngtu a nih.

en: To him the porter openeth; and the sheep hear his voice: and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.
hmr: Kawtkhâr vêngtuin ama chu a lo hawng pêk hlak a; berâmhaiin a râwl an hriet hlak a; ama berâmhai chu an hmingin a ko seng a, a ṭhuoi suok hlak a.

en: When he hath put forth all his own, he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him: for they know his voice.
hmr: A ta po po ân suoktir phingleh, an hma a ṭhuoi a, berâmhaiin ama an zu i hlak a, a râwl an hriet sih a.

en: And a stranger will they not follow, but will flee from him: for they know not the voice of strangers.
hmr: Mi dang chu zui naw ni hai a, tlân hmang san lem an tih; mi danghai râwl chu an hriet naw leiin,” a ta.

en: This parable spake Jesus unto them: but they understood not what things they were which he spake unto them.
hmr: Chu tekhithu chu Isûn an kuomah a hril a; nisienlakhawm, ieng thu am a na an kuomah a hril an hriet si nawh a.

en: Jesus therefore said unto them again, Verily, verily, I say unto you, I am the door of the sheep.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn an kuomah a hril nâwk a, “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, kei hi berâm kawtkhâr chu ka nih,

en: All that came before me are thieves and robbers: but the sheep did not hear them.
hmr: ka hmaa hunghai po po kha inruhmanghai, suomhmanghai an ni vawng a; nisienlakhawm, berâmhai chun an thu an awi nawh.

en: I am the door; by me if any man enter in, he shall be saved, and shall go in and go out, and shall find pasture.
hmr: Kei kawtkhâr chu ka nih; tûkhawm keimaah a lût chun, humhimin um a ta, lûtin suok a ta, fâk ding hmu bawk a tih.

en: The thief cometh not, but that he may steal, and kill, and destroy: I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.
hmr: Inruhmang chu, inru ding le, sukhlum ding le sukse ding naw chun a hung nawh; kei chu hringna an neina dingin, tamtaka an neina dinga hung ka nih.

en: I am the good shepherd: the good shepherd layeth down his life for the sheep.
hmr: Kei bêram vêngtu ṭha chu ka nih; berâm vêngtu ṭha chun berâmhai ta dingin a hringna a pêk hlak.

en: He that is a hireling, and not a shepherd, whose own the sheep are not, beholdeth the wolf coming, and leaveth the sheep, and fleeth, and the wolf snatcheth them, and scattereth them:
hmr: Inhlawfa, berâm vêngtu tak ni loa, berâmhai a ta ni lo chun satene hung a hmu chun berâmhai a tlânsan hlak; chun, satene chun berâmhai a seh a, a sukdar hlak;

en: he fleeth because he is a hireling, and careth not for the sheep.
hmr: inhlawfa a na, berâmhai a ngai- sak naw leiin a tlânsan hlak a nih.

en: I am the good shepherd; and I know mine own, and mine own know me,
hmr: Kei chu berâm vêngtu ṭha ka nih; ka ta chu ka hriet a, ka ta khawmin an mi hriet a nih,

en: even as the Father knoweth me, and I know the Father; and I lay down my life for the sheep.
hmr: Pain a mi hriet a, kei khawmin Pa ka hriet ang hin; chun, berâmhai ta ding chun ka hringna ka pêk.

en: And other sheep I have, which are not of this fold: them also I must bring, and they shall hear my voice; and they shall become one flock, one shepherd.
hmr: Chun, hi berâm huona mi naw khawm hi, berâm dang ka nei; anni khawm ka la hung ṭhuoi ding a nih, ka râwl khawm hrieng an tih, chuongchun, pâwl khatin um an ta, a vêngtu pakhat leh.

en: Therefore doth the Father love me, because I lay down my life, that I may take it again.
hmr: “Hi lei hin Pain a mi hmangai a nih, lâk nâwk dinga ka hringna ka pêk ding leiin.

en: No one taketh it away from me, but I lay it down of myself. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it again. This commandment received I from my Father.
hmr: Tûkhawmin mi lâkpêk naw ni hai, keima thu thuin ka pêk lem ding a nih; pe thei ka nih, la nâwk thei khawm ka nih. Hi thupêk hi ka Pa kuoma inthawka ka hmu a nih,” a ta.

en: There arose a division again among the Jews because of these words.
hmr: Chuong thu lei chun Judahai an inṭheh a, an inkhing nâwk a.

en: And many of them said, He hath a demon, and is mad; why hear ye him?
hmr: A ṭhen tamtakin, “Khawhri a zâwl a, ân vêt a ni hi; iengdinga a thu in ngai am a na?” an ta.

en: Others said, These are not the sayings of one possessed with a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?
hmr: A ṭhenin, “Hieng thu hi khawhri zâwl thuhril a ni nawh ie. Khawhri chun mitdel mit a sukvar thei am a nih?” an ta.

en: And it was the feast of the dedication at Jerusalem:
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema Inpumpêk Ruoiṭhe lai a na; chu chu thlasik lai a nih.

en: it was winter; and Jesus was walking in the temple in Solomon’s porch.
hmr: Chun, Isu Pathien biekinah, Solomon tuolpûka chun ân lawn ân lawn a.

en: The Jews therefore came round about him, and said unto him, How long dost thou hold us in suspense? If thou art the Christ, tell us plainly.
hmr: Chun, Judahai a kâwlah an hung a, a kuomah, “Ieng chen am lungâwpinkaiin i mi sie ding a na? Krista i ni chun feltakin mi hril rawh,” an ta.

en: Jesus answered them, I told you, and ye believe not: the works that I do in my Father’s name, these bear witness of me.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Ka hril ta cheu kha in awi si nawh; ka Pa hminga thil ka thaw hi, hieng hin ka chanchin ân hriettir a ni hi.

en: But ye believe not, because ye are not of my sheep.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, in awi si nawh, ka berâm laia mi in ni naw leiin.

en: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me:
hmr: Ka berâmhaiin ka râwl an hriet hlak, kei khawmin anni chu ka hriet, anni chun an mi zui hlak.

en: and I give unto them eternal life; and they shall never perish, and no one shall snatch them out of my hand.
hmr: An kuomah chatuona hringna ka pêk hlak; kumkhuoin bohmang naw ni hai a, tukhawmin ka kuta inthawkin mi lâkpêk bawk naw ni hai.

en: My Father, who hath given them unto me, is greater than all; and no one is able to snatch them out of the Father’s hand.
hmr: Anni mi petu ka Pa chu mi po po nêka ropui a nih, tukhawmin Pa kuta inthawk chu lâkpêk thei naw ni hai.

en: I and the Father are one.
hmr: Kei le Pa chu pumkhat kan nih,” tiin a dawn a.

en: The Jews took up stones again to stone him.
hmr: Chun, Judahai chun a dêngna dingin lung an rût nâwk a.

en: Jesus answered them, Many good works have I showed you from the Father; for which of those works do ye stone me?
hmr: Chun, Isûn anni chu a biek a, “Pa kuoma inthawka suok sinthaw ṭha tamtak kân entir cheu a, khâng sinthawhai laia ieng sinthaw lei khan am a ni lunga in mi dêng ding hi?” a ta.

en: The Jews answered him, For a good work we stone thee not, but for blasphemy; and because that thou, being a man, makest thyself God.
hmr: Judahai chun a kuomah, “Sin ṭha chunga lunga dêng ding che kan ni nawh a; Pathien i hrilsietna chunga le, nang mihriem ni sih a, Pathiena în siem lei hin a ni lem a nih,” tiin an dawn a.

en: Jesus answered them, Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are gods?
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “In Dân lekhabuah, ‘Pathienhai in nih ka tih,’ ti ziek a ni naw am a nih?

en: If he called them gods, unto whom the word of God came (and the scripture cannot be broken),
hmr: Pathien thu tlungnahai hman pathienhai an ti chun, (Pathien Lekha thu bân thei a ni si nawh a)

en: say ye of him, whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, Thou blasphemest; because I said, I am the Son of God?
hmr: Pain a iruot, khawvêla a itir chunga hin, ‘Pathien Naupa ka nih,’ ka ti leiin, ‘Pathien i hrilsiet,’ in ti a ni maw?

en: If I do not the works of my Father, believe me not.
hmr: Ka pa sinthaw ka ni naw chun mi ring naw ro.

en: But if I do them, though ye believe not me, believe the works: that ye may know and understand that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.
hmr: Amiruokchu, thaw ka ni chun, kei mi ring naw unla khawm, sin- thawhai bêk hi ring ro; Pa keimaah a um ti le, kei Paah ka um ti in hriet a, in ringna dingin,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: They sought again to take him: and he went forth out of their hand.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama chu man an tum nâwk a, nisienlakhawm, an kuta inthawkin a suok a.

en: And he went away again beyond the Jordan into the place where John was at the first baptizing; and there he abode.
hmr: Jordan vadung râlah, Johanin a tîra mi a baptisna hmun tieng khan a fe hmang nâwk tah a, chutaka chun a um ta zing a.

en: And many came unto him; and they said, John indeed did no sign: but all things whatsoever John spake of this man were true.
hmr: Chun, mi tamtak a kuomah an hung a, “Johanin thilmak iengkhawm chu a thaw nawh a; nisienlakhawm, Johanin hi mipa chungchâng thu a hril taphawt kha chu ân dik hle hi,” an ta.

en: And many believed on him there.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun mi tam- takin ama an ring tah a.

en: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus of Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
hmr: Chun, mi pakhat, Mari le a zuorpuinu Martha umna khuo Bethania mi, Lazar damnaw a um a.

en: And it was that Mary who anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was sick.
hmr: (Mari, hriek rim inhnik Lal chu nâla, a sama a ke hrutu kha, kha minu ṭapa Lazar a nih dam naw chu.)

en: The sisters therefore sent unto him, saying, Lord, behold, he whom thou lovest is sick.
hmr: Chun, a farnuhaiin Isu kuomah, “Lalpa, ngai ta, i hmangai kha a damnaw ie,” tiin mi an tir a.

en: But when Jesus heard it, he said, This sickness is not unto death, but for the glory of God, that the Son of God may be glorified thereby.
hmr: Isûn chu chu a hriet a, “Hi natna hi thina ding a ni nawh, Pathien ropuina ding a ni lem, Pathien Naupa chu hi lei hin a la mawina dingin,” a ta.

en: Now Jesus loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
hmr: Chun, Isûn Martha hai, a zuor- puinu hai, Lazar hai a hmangai a.

en: When therefore he heard that he was sick, he abode at that time two days in the place where he was.
hmr: Chuleiin, a damnaw ti a hrietin a umna ngaiah ni hni a la um ta rawp a.

en: Then after this he saith to the disciples, Let us go into Judæa again.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun a închûktirhai kuomah, “Judai ramah fe nâwk ei tiu,” a ta.

en: The disciples say unto him, Rabbi, the Jews were but now seeking to stone thee; and goest thou thither again?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Rabbi, kha hma el khan Judahaiin lunga dêng an tum che kha; chuong sa sa chun chutaka chun i la fe rawp ding am a nih?” an ta.

en: Jesus answered, Are there not twelve hours in the day? If a man walk in the day, he stumbleth not, because he seeth the light of this world.
hmr: Isûn, “Sûnah dârkâr sâwm le pahni a um naw am a nih? Mi sûnah a lêng chun a pêm ngai nawh, hi khawvêl var hi a hmu leiin.

en: But if a man walk in the night, he stumbleth, because the light is not in him.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mi zânah a lêng chun a pêm hlak, amaa chun var a um naw leiin,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: These things spake he: and after this he saith unto them, Our friend Lazarus is fallen asleep; but I go, that I may awake him out of sleep.
hmr: Chuong thu chu a hril a; chun, chu hnunga chun an kuomah, “Ei ruolpa Lazar chu a ininnghil tah a; a ininnghil keihar dingin ka fe ding a nih,” a ta.

en: The disciples therefore said unto him, Lord, if he is fallen asleep, he will recover.
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Lalpa a ininnghil a ni chun dam nâwk el a tih,” an ta.

en: Now Jesus had spoken of his death: but they thought that he spake of taking rest in sleep.
hmr: (Isûn a thi thu a hril a nih; nisienlakhawm, anni chun a châwl sûnga a ininnghil thu a hril amanih an ta.)

en: Then Jesus therefore said unto them plainly, Lazarus is dead.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn fietakin an kuomah a hril a, “Lazar a thi a nih.

en: And I am glad for your sakes that I was not there, to the intent ye may believe; nevertheless let us go unto him.
hmr: Chutaka ka um naw chu ka lâwm pêk cheu, in ring theina dingin; nisienlakhawm, a kuomah fêng ei tiu,” a ta.

en: Thomas therefore, who is called Didymus, said unto his fellow-disciples, Let us also go, that we may die with him.
hmr: Chun, Thoma (Didum an ti bawk) chun, ân chûktir chanpuihai kuomah, “A thinaa thi ve dingin fe vêng ei tiu,” a ta.

en: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn a tlung chun, ni li thlânah a lo um tah ti a hriet a,

en: Now Bethany was nigh unto Jerusalem, about fifteen furlongs off;
hmr: Bethani chu Jerusalem kâwl a na, fing sâwmpanga laia hla a nih;

en: and many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary, to console them concerning their brother.
hmr: chuongchun, an ṭapa thi chunga sukthlamuong dingin Judahai rawi tamtak Martha le Mari kuomah an hung a.

en: Martha therefore, when she heard that Jesus was coming, went and met him: but Mary still sat in the house.
hmr: Martha chun Isu a hung ding a nih ti a hriet phingleh a va tuok a; Mari ruok chu inah a la ṭhung zing a.

en: Martha therefore said unto Jesus, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
hmr: Chun, Martha chun Isu kuomah, “Lalpa hitaka um ni la chu, ka ṭapa a thi naw ding bah.

en: And even now I know that, whatsoever thou shalt ask of God, God will give thee.
hmr: Tukhawm hin Pathien kuoma i ngên taphawt chu Pathienin pêng a ti che ti ka hriet,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Thy brother shall rise again.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “I ṭapa tho nâwk a tih,” a ta.

en: Martha saith unto him, I know that he shall rise again in the resurrection at the last day.
hmr: Martha chun a kuomah, “Ni kin nia, thonâwknaa chun thonâwk a tih ti ka hriet,” a ta.

en: Jesus said unto her, I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth on me, though he die, yet shall he live;
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Kei hi thonâwkna le hringna chu ka nih; tûkhawm a mi ring chu thi sienla khawm hring zing a tih;

en: and whosoever liveth and believeth on me shall never die. Believest thou this?
hmr: tukhawm a hring taphawt a mi ring chu kumkhuoin thi naw nih; chu thu chu i ring am?” a ta.

en: She saith unto him, Yea, Lord: I have believed that thou art the Christ, the Son of God, even he that cometh into the world.
hmr: Ama chun a kuomah, “Ring e Lalpa, Krista, Pathien Naupa, khawvêla hung ding chu i ni ti ka ring ie,” a ta.

en: And when she had said this, she went away, and called Mary her sister secretly, saying, The Teacher is here, and calleth thee.
hmr: Chun, chu thu chu a hril zo phingleh a feh a, a zuorpuinu Mari chu inrûkin a va ko a, “Inchûktirtu hitakah a um a, a ko che,” a ta.

en: And she, when she heard it, arose quickly, and went unto him.
hmr: Ama chun chu chu a hriet phingleh a tho vak a, a kuomah a va feh a.

en: (Now Jesus was not yet come into the village, but was still in the place where Martha met him.)
hmr: (Isu chu khuo a la lût nawh a, Marthain a va tuok laia, a umna ngaiah a la um a.)

en: The Jews then who were with her in the house, and were consoling her, when they saw Mary, that she rose up quickly and went out, followed her, supposing that she was going unto the tomb to weep there.
hmr: In sûnga a thlamuongtu a umpui Judahai chun, Mari a tho vaka, a suok an hmu phingleh, thlâna ṭap dingin a fe amanih an ta, an zui a.

en: Mary therefore, when she came where Jesus was, and saw him, fell down at his feet, saying unto him, Lord, if thou hadst been here, my brother had not died.
hmr: Chun, Mari chun Isu umna chu a va tlung a, a hmu phingleh a ke bulah a bawkkhup a, a kuomah, “Lalpa, hitaka um ni la chu ka ṭapa a thi naw ding bah,” a ta.

en: When Jesus therefore saw her weeping, and the Jews also weeping who came with her, he groaned in the spirit, and was troubled,
hmr: Isu chun Mari ṭap le a hung zuitu Judahai ṭap chu a hmuin, a lungrilin ân rûm a, a lungngai a.

en: and said, Where have ye laid him? They say unto him, Lord, come and see.
hmr: “Ama chu khâwlai am in inzâl a?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, hung la, en ta,” an ta.

en: Jesus wept.
hmr: Isu a ṭap tah a.

en: The Jews therefore said, Behold how he loved him!
hmr: Chun, Judahai chun, “En ta u, Lazar hi a lo va hmangai deh e!” an ta.

en: But some of them said, Could not this man, who opened the eyes of him that was blind, have caused that this man also should not die?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ṭhenkhat chun, “Hi mitdel mit sukvartu hin, hi mipa khawm hi ân thi naw tir thei naw am a nih?” an ta.

en: Jesus therefore again groaning in himself cometh to the tomb. Now it was a cave, and a stone lay against it.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu a lungrilin ân rûm nâwk a, thlân chu a tlung tah a. Chu thlân chu pûk a na, a kawtkhâra chun lung pakhat a um a.

en: Jesus saith, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith unto him, Lord, by this time the body decayeth; for he hath been dead four days.
hmr: Isûn, “Lung hi dawm tâwl ro,” a ta. A thipa farnu Martha chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, tuhin chu thu tâng a tih, a thina ni li a ni ta sih a,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Said I not unto thee, that, if thou believedst, thou shouldest see the glory of God?
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “I ring chun Pathien ropuizie hmûng i tih, ka ti naw che am a nih?” a ta.

en: So they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, Father, I thank thee that thou heardest me.
hmr: Chuongchun, lung chu an dawm tâwl a. Chun, Isu a dâk a, “Pa, ka thu i ngai leiin i chungah ka lâwm ie.

en: And I knew that thou hearest me always: but because of the multitude that standeth around I said it, that they may believe that thou didst send me.
hmr: Kumkhuoin ka thu i ngai hlak ti ka hriet zing a nih; nisienlakhawm, mipui ngîr khup lei hin chu chu ka ti a nih, nangin i mi tir ti an ring theina dingin,” a ta.

en: And when he had thus spoken, he cried with a loud voice, Lazarus, come forth.
hmr: Chun, chuonga a ṭawng zo phingleh râwl inringtakin, “Lazar, hung suok rawh,” a ta, a khêk a.

en: He that was dead came forth, bound hand and foot with grave-clothes; and his face was bound about with a napkin. Jesus saith unto them, Loose him, and let him go.
hmr: Mithi chu a kut a ke thlân puona tuom pumin a hung suok tah a, a hmai chu inhrûkna puona tuom a nih. Isûn an kuomah, “Sût unla, infetir ro,” a ta.

en: Many therefore of the Jews, who came to Mary and beheld that which he did, believed on him.
hmr: Chuleichun, Mari lêngpuitu Isu thilthaw hmu Juda mi tamtakin Isu an ring tah a.

en: But some of them went away to the Pharisees, and told them the things which Jesus had done.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a ṭhen Phari- saihai kuomah an va feh a, an kuomah Isu thilthawhai chu an hril a.

en: The chief priests therefore and the Pharisees gathered a council, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many signs.
hmr: Chuongchun, thiempu lalhai le Pharisaihai chun rorêltuhai an ko khâwm a, “Iengtin am thâwng ei ta? Hi mipa hin thilmak tamtak a thaw sih a.

en: If we let him thus alone, all men will believe on him: and the Romans will come and take away both our place and our nation.
hmr: Hieng anga ei thlathlam el chun mi po poin ama ring an ta; chun, Roma mihai hung an ta, ei hmun le ei chihai hi mi lâkpêk an tih,” an ta.

en: But a certain one of them, Caiaphas, being high priest that year, said unto them, Ye know nothing at all,
hmr: Chun, anni laia mi pakhat, Kaiapha, chu kuma Thiempu Laltak chun an kuomah, “Nangnîn ieng- khawm in hriet dêr nawh.

en: nor do ye take account that it is expedient for you that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation perish not.
hmr: Ei chi po po bohmang nawna dingin, mi po po nêka mi pakhat thi in ta dingin a ṭha ti in ngaituo bawk nawh,” a ta.

en: Now this he said not of himself: but being high priest that year, he prophesied that Jesus should die for the nation;
hmr: (Chu thu chu ama phuok- fâwmin a hril nawh, chu kum chun Thiempu Laltak a na, an chihai nêka Isu a thi ding thu a hril lâwk a ni lem.

en: and not for the nation only, but that he might also gather together into one the children of God that are scattered abroad.
hmr: Chuhai chihai ai chau chun a ni nawh, Pathien nau khawvêla indarhai po po pâwl khata a ṭhuoi khâwmna dingin a ni bawk.)

en: So from that day forth they took counsel that they might put him to death.
hmr: Chuongchun, chu ni chena inthawk chu ama sukhlum dingin an inrâwn rawp a.

en: Jesus therefore walked no more openly among the Jews, but departed thence into the country near to the wilderness, into a city called Ephraim; and there he tarried with the disciples.
hmr: Chuleiin, Isu chu Judahai lai ân langin a lêng nâwk ta nawh a, chutaka inthawkin thlalêr dep tienga khaw pakhat Ephraim an tia chun a va fe ta lem a; chutaka chun inchûktirhai leh an um ta zing a.

en: Now the passover of the Jews was at hand: and many went up to Jerusalem out of the country before the passover, to purify themselves.
hmr: Chun, Judahai Fekân Ruoiṭhe chu a hnai tah a, mi tamtak inthien dingin rama inthawk, Fekân Ruoiṭhe hma chun, Jerusalemah an hang feh a.

en: They sought therefore for Jesus, and spake one with another, as they stood in the temple, What think ye? That he will not come to the feast?
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu an zawng a, Pathien biekinah ngir pumin an inbiek a, “Ieng am in ring a? Ruoi- ṭhenaah hung naw ni maw?” an in tih a.

en: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given commandment, that, if any man knew where he was, he should show it, that they might take him.
hmr: Thiempu Lalhai le Pharisai- haiin ama chu an man theina dingin tûkhawmin a umna an hriet chun phuong ding a nih ti thu an pêk ta sih a.

en: Jesus therefore six days before the passover came to Bethany, where Lazarus was, whom Jesus raised from the dead.
hmr: Chun, Fekân Ruoiṭhena ding ni ruk a la umin, Isu mithi laia inthawka a keitho Lazar umna Bethani kha a hung tlung a.

en: So they made him a supper there: and Martha served; but Lazarus was one of them that sat at meat with him.
hmr: Chun, chutaka chun ama ta dingin zânah ruoi an ṭheh a; Martha chun rawng a bâwl a, Lazar chu a thlaithlêng awtpuitu pakhat a nih.

en: Mary therefore took a pound of ointment of pure nard, very precious, and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hair: and the house was filled with the odor of the ointment.
hmr: Chun, Mariin bûk zâtve Spiknard hriek rim inhnik totak a hung chawi a, Isu kehai a nâl a, a samin a kehai chu a hrûk a; chuongchun, chu hriek rim chun in chu a sip rum rum el a.

en: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, that should betray him, saith,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Iskariot Juda, a închûktir pakhat, ân mantirtu ding chun,

en: Why was not this ointment sold for three hundred shillings, and given to the poor?
hmr: “Hi hriek rim inhnik hi iengdinga duli za thuma zawra pasiehai kuoma an pêk lem naw am a na?” a ta.

en: Now this he said, not because he cared for the poor; but because he was a thief, and having the bag took away what was put therein.
hmr: (Pasiehai a ngaisak leia chu thu chu hril a ni nawh; inru a na, tangka ip a kawl a, a sûnga um chu a lâk hlak lei a ni lem a).

en: Jesus therefore said, Suffer her to keep it against the day of my burying.
hmr: Chun, Isûn, “Tosan rawh, an mi phûm nia dingin khêk raw se.

en: For the poor ye have always with you; but me ye have not always.
hmr: Pasiehai chu kumkhuoin in kuoma um an nih, kei ruok chu kumkhuoa in kuoma um ding ka ni nawh,” a ta.

en: The common people therefore of the Jews learned that he was there: and they came, not for Jesus’ sake only, but that they might see Lazarus also, whom he had raised from the dead.
hmr: Chun, Isu chutaka chun a um ti Juda mi narânhai chun an lo hriet tah a; chun, an hung a, Isu chau chu an hungna san a ni nawh a, mithi laia inthawka a keitho Lazar khawm kha hmu dingin a ni bawk a.

en: But the chief priests took counsel that they might put Lazarus also to death;
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai chu Lazar khawm sukhlum dingin an inrâwn a;

en: because that by reason of him many of the Jews went away, and believed on Jesus.
hmr: ama leia Juda tamtakin an pakai san a, Isu an ring hlak leiin.

en: On the morrow a great multitude that had come to the feast, when they heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
hmr: A zînga chun, ruoiṭhenaa hung mipui tamtakin Isu Jerusalemah a hung ding a nih ti an hrietin,

en: took the branches of the palm trees, and went forth to meet him, and cried out, Hosanna: Blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord, even the King of Israel.
hmr: tûm kauhai an chawi a, a tuok dingin an va suok a, “Hosanna, Lalpa hminga Israel Lal hung chu inpâkin um raw se,” tiin an khêk a.

en: And Jesus, having found a young ass, sat thereon; as it is written,
hmr: Chun, Isûn sabengtungtê a hmuh a, a chungah a chuong a,

en: Fear not, daughter of Zion: behold, thy King cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt.
hmr: “Ṭi naw, Zion naunu, En ta, i Lal chu, Sabengtungtê chunga chuongin, A hung ding a nih,” ti ziek ang khan.

en: These things understood not his disciples at the first: but when Jesus was glorified, then remembered they that these things were written of him, and that they had done these things unto him.
hmr: Chuong thu chu a tîrin a închûktirhaiin an hriet nawh; nisien- lakhawm, Isu chawimawia a um hnung chun, a chanchinah chuong thu chu ziek a nih ti le, a chungah chuong thil chu an lo thaw ngei ti an hriet tah a.

en: The multitude therefore that was with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb, and raised him from the dead, bare witness.
hmr: Chun, Lazar thlâna inthawka a ko suok a, mithi laia inthawka a keitho laia mipui umhai khan, a thu chu an inhriettir ta pei a.

en: For this cause also the multitude went and met him, for that they heard that he had done this sign.
hmr: Chu lei chun a nih mipuihai khawmin ama chu an tuok chu; chu thilmak chu a thaw ti an hriet sih a.

en: The Pharisees therefore said among themselves, Behold how ye prevail nothing; lo, the world is gone after him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pharisaihai chun, “Hre ro, iengkhawm in law thei naw hi; en ta u, khawvêlin ama an zui ta hi,” an ta.

en: Now there were certain Greeks among those that went up to worship at the feast:
hmr: Chun, ruoiṭhenaa Pathien chibai bûk dinga hang fehai lai Grik tuhai amanih an um a.

en: these therefore came to Philip, who was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and asked him, saying, Sir, we would see Jesus.
hmr: Chuonghai chu Galili rama Bethsaida khuoa mi Philip kuoma chun an hung a, a kuomah, “Pu, Isu hmu kan nuom,” an ta, an ngên a.

en: Philip cometh and telleth Andrew: Andrew cometh, and Philip, and they tell Jesus.
hmr: Philip chun Andri a hung hril a; Andri le Philip chun Isu an hung hril a.

en: And Jesus answereth them, saying, The hour is come, that the Son of man should be glorified.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, an kuomah, “Mihriem Naupa chawi- mawia a um hun chu a tlung tah.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, Except a grain of wheat fall into the earth and die, it abideth by itself alone; but if it die, it beareth much fruit.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, bu mal hnuoiah a tlah a, a thi naw chun, a mal chauin a um zing hlak; a thi ruok chun tamtakin a ra hlak.

en: He that loveth his life loseth it; and he that hateth his life in this world shall keep it unto life eternal.
hmr: Tûkhawm a hringna thlâkhla chun ân hmang hlak, tûkhawm hi khawvêla hin a hringna ngaitlâwm chun chatuona hringna vawng zing a tih.

en: If any man serve me, let him follow me; and where I am, there shall also my servant be: if any man serve me, him will the Father honor.
hmr: Tûkhawmin ka rawng a bâwl chun mi zui raw se; ka umnaah ka rawng bâwltu khawm um a tih. Tûkhawmin ka rawng a bâwl chun ama chu Pain chawimawi a tih.

en: Now is my soul troubled; and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour. But for this cause came I unto this hour.
hmr: “Tuhin ka lungril a lunginzîng, ieng am hril ka ta aw? ‘Pa, hi huna inthawk hin mi sanhim rawh,’ ka ti ding am a nih? Ti lo e, hi ding lei taka hi, hi huna hi hung ka nih,

en: Father, glorify thy name. There came therefore a voice out of heaven, saying, I have both glorified it, and will glorify it again.
hmr: Pa, i hming inchawimawi rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, vâna inthawkin râwl a hung suok a, “Ka chawimawi tah, chawimawi nâwk bawk ka tih,” a ta.

en: The multitude therefore, that stood by, and heard it, said that it had thundered: others said, An angel hath spoken to him.
hmr: Chun, mipui a kâwla ngîrhai chun chu chu an hriet a, “Vân ân rûm a nih,” an ta, mi danghaiin, “Vantirkoin ama a biek a nih,” an ta.

en: Jesus answered and said, This voice hath not come for my sake, but for your sakes.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, “Chu râwl chu ka ta dinga hung suok a ni nawh, nangni ta dingin a ni lem.

en: Now is the judgment of this world: now shall the prince of this world be cast out.
hmr: Tuhin hi khawvêl hi ngaituo lai a nih; tuhin hi khawvêl lal hi pei suok nîng a tih.

en: And I, if I be lifted up from the earth, will draw all men unto myself.
hmr: Chun, kei hnuoia inthawka khaikânga ka um chun, mi po po keia tieng hîp ka tih,” a ta.

en: But this he said, signifying by what manner of death he should die.
hmr: Chu thu chu a thizie ding inhriettirna dingin a hril a nih.

en: The multitude therefore answered him, We have heard out of the law that the Christ abideth for ever: and how sayest thou, The Son of man must be lifted up? who is this Son of man?
hmr: Chun, mipui chun a kuomah, “Krista chu chatuonin a um zing ding a nih ti Dân Lekhabuah kan hriet ie, nangin, ‘Mihriem Naupa khaikângin a um ding a nih,’ ieng ti tia ti am i na? Chu Mihriem Naupa chu tu am a na?” an ta, an dawn a.

en: Jesus therefore said unto them, Yet a little while is the light among you. Walk while ye have the light, that darkness overtake you not: and he that walketh in the darkness knoweth not whither he goeth.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Var hi nangni lai sâwt nawte a la um hri hi, var in nei sûng hin lêng ro, inthimin a nang nawna ding cheuin; tûkhawm inthima lêng chun a fena chin a hriet ngai nawh.

en: While ye have the light, believe on the light, that ye may become sons of light. These things spake Jesus, and he departed and hid himself from them.
hmr: Var in nei sûng hin var hi ring ro, var nauhai in hung ni theina dingin,” a ta. Chuong thu chu Isûn a hril a, chun, a feh a, an hmu naw dingin ân bihmang a.

en: But though he had done so many signs before them, yet they believed not on him:
hmr: An hmaah chuong ang thilmak tamtak thaw sienla khawm ama an ring si nawh:

en: that the word of Isaiah the prophet might be fulfilled, which he spake, Lord, who hath believed our report? And to whom hath the arm of the Lord been revealed?
hmr: “Lalpa, kan thu hril tuin am a ring a? Lalpa kut khawm tu kuom âm ân lang a?” ti, Zâwlnei Isaiin a hril kha a tlungna dingin.

en: For this cause they could not believe, for that Isaiah said again,
hmr: Hi lei hin a nih an ring thei naw, Isaiin,

en: He hath blinded their eyes, and he hardened their heart; Lest they should see with their eyes, and perceive with their heart, And should turn, And I should heal them.
hmr: “Amain an mit a sukdel a, An lungril a sukvêt a; Chuong naw chun, an mitin hmu rawi an ta, An lungrilin hre rawi an ta, Ngha kîr nâwk rawi an ta; Keiin anni sukdam rawi ka tih,” ti a hril nâwk lei hin.

en: These things said Isaiah, because he saw his glory; and he spake of him.
hmr: Isaiin a ropuizie a hmu le a chanchin a hril lei hin chuong thu chu a hril a nih.

en: Nevertheless even of the rulers many believed on him; but because of the Pharisees they did not confess it, lest they should be put out of the synagogue:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hotuhai a ṭhen tamtakin Isu an ring tah a; amiruokchu, Pharisaihai leiin an inphuong nawh; chuong naw chun, inkhâwmna in hnawngin um an tih.

en: for they loved the glory that is of men more than the glory that is of God.
hmr: Pathien kuoma ropuina nêkin mihriem kuoma ropuina an dit lem sih a.

en: And Jesus cried and said, He that believeth on me, believeth not on me, but on him that sent me.
hmr: Chun, Isu a khêk a, “Tûkhawm keia mi ring chu keia mi ring a ni nawh a, a mi tirtu ring a ni lem.

en: And he that beholdeth me beholdeth him that sent me.
hmr: Tûkhawm a mi hmu chu a mi tirtu hmu a nih.

en: I am come a light into the world, that whosoever believeth on me may not abide in the darkness.
hmr: êntua khawvêla hung ka ni hi, tûkhawm a mi ring taphawt inthima an um zing nawna dingin.

en: And if any man hear my sayings, and keep them not, I judge him not: for I came not to judge the world, but to save the world.
hmr: Tûkhawm ka thu hril hrein awi naw sienla khawm, keiin thiemnaw kân chang tir nawh; khawvêl thiemnaw inchangtir dinga hung ka ni nawh a; khawvêl sanhim dinga hung ka ni lem.

en: He that rejecteth me, and receiveth not my sayings, hath one that judgeth him: the word that I spake, the same shall judge him in the last day.
hmr: Tûkhawm mi dit loa, ka thu hrilhai vawn lo chun, thiemnaw inchangtirtu pakhat a nei a nih; ka thu hril kha, kha thu ngei khan ni kin nia chun ama thiemnaw inchangtir a tih.

en: For I spake not from myself; but the Father that sent me, he hath given me a commandment, what I should say, and what I should speak.
hmr: Keia phuokfâwmin ka hril si nawh; Pa a mi tirtu chun, ka hril ding le ka ṭawngna ding chu thu a mi pêk a ni lem.

en: And I know that his commandment is life eternal; the things therefore which I speak, even as the Father hath said unto me, so I speak.
hmr: Ama thupêk chu chatuona hringna a nih ti ka hriet, chuleichun, thu ka hrilhai hi Pa mi hril ang peiin ka hril a nih,” a ta.

en: Now before the feast of the passover, Jesus knowing that his hour was come that he should depart out of this world unto the Father, having loved his own that were in the world, he loved them unto the end.
hmr: Chun, Fekân Ruoiṭhe hmain Isûn hi khawvêl hi suok sana, Pa kuoma a fe hun a tlung tah ti a hriet a. Amaa mi khawvêla um a hmangai hlakhai chu, a tâwp chen khawmin a hmangai zing a.

en: And during supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon’s son, to betray him,
hmr: Chun, zânbu fâk laiin, (chu hma khawm chun diebolin Simon naupa Iskariot Juda chu Isu inmantir dingin ân lungriltir a,)

en: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands, and that he came forth from God, and goeth unto God,
hmr: Isûn Pain a kuta thil iengkim ân kawltir dâm, Pathien kuoma in- thawka hung suok a ni dâm, Pathien kuoma a fe ding dâm hre zingin,

en: riseth from supper, and layeth aside his garments; and he took a towel, and girded himself.
hmr: a zânbu awt chu a tho a, a puonhai a sieh a, inhrûkna puon a lâk a, a dierkei a.

en: Then he poureth water into the basin, and began to wash the disciples’ feet, and to wipe them with the towel wherewith he was girded.
hmr: Chun, châwtawlah tui a sung a, inchûktirhai ke a sâwp a, inhrûkna puon a dierkei chun a hrûk pei a.

en: So he cometh to Simon Peter. He saith unto him, Lord, dost thou wash my feet?
hmr: Chuongchun, Simon Peter kuomah a hung a. Ama chun, “Lalpa, nang êmin ka ke i sâwp ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto him, What I do thou knowest not now; but thou shalt understand hereafter.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Ka thilthaw hi tuhin i hriet nawh; nisienlakhawm, nakie tieng la hrieng i tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Peter saith unto him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered him, If I wash thee not, thou hast no part with me.
hmr: Peterin a kuomah, “Ka ke sâwp naw tawp i tih!” a ta; Isûn a kuomah, “Ka sâwp naw che chun ka kuomah iengkhawm chan nei naw ti nih,” a ta.

en: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, not my feet only, but also my hands and my head.
hmr: Simon Peter chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, chuong a ni chun, ka ke chau ni loin, ka kut le ka lu khawm tie,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith to him, He that is bathed needeth not save to wash his feet, but is clean every whit: and ye are clean, but not all.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Insil ta chu a ke naw chu sâwp a ngai nawh, a fai deh annâwm; nangni in fai, in rêng ruok chun ni loin,” a ta.

en: For he knew him that should betray him; therefore said he, Ye are not all clean.
hmr: (Ân mantirtu ding chu a hriet sih a; chuleiin, “In rêngin in fai nawh,” a ti a nih.)

en: So when he had washed their feet, and taken his garments, and sat down again, he said unto them, Know ye what I have done to you?
hmr: Chuongchun, an ke a sâwp a, a puonhai a lâk a, a ṭhung nâwk chun an kuomah, “In chunga ka thilthaw hi ieng thawna am a na, in hriet am?

en: Ye call me, Teacher, and, Lord: and ye say well; for so I am.
hmr: Nangnîn Inchûktirtu le Lalpa in mi ti hlak; in ti indik hle, ka ni ngei hrim a.

en: If I then, the Lord and the Teacher, have washed your feet, ye also ought to wash one another’s feet.
hmr: Kei Lalpa le Inchûktirtu hmanin in ke ka sâwp chun, nangni khawmin in ke in insâwppêk ding a nih.

en: For I have given you an example, that ye also should do as I have done to you.
hmr: In chunga ka thaw ang hin nangni khawmin in thaw vena dingin ka sukhmu cheu a ni sih a.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, A servant is not greater than his lord; neither one that is sent greater than he that sent him.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, suok a pu nêkin a ropui nawh; tirko khawm a tirtu nêkin a ropui bawk nawh.

en: If ye know these things, blessed are ye if ye do them.
hmr: Chuong thil chu in hriet chun, thaw unla, hamṭhâng in tih.

en: I speak not of you all: I know whom I have chosen: but that the scripture may be fulfilled, He that eateth my bread lifted up his heel against me.
hmr: In rênga thu ka hril nawh; ka ithlang hai chu ka hriet, nisienlakhawm, chu chu, ‘Ka bei fatu chun, A kekhawng chu ka chungah ân let tah,’ ti Pathien Lekha Thu kha a hung tlung theina dingin a nih.

en: From henceforth I tell you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe that I am he.
hmr: Hi hi a hung tlung hmain tuhin ka hril cheu hi, a hung tlung phaleh, kei kha ka nih ti in ring theina dingin.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that receiveth whomsoever I send receiveth me; and he that receiveth me receiveth him that sent me.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, tûkhawm ka itir taphawt lâwm chu, keima mi lâwm a nih; tûkhawm kei mi lâwm chu a mi tirtu lâwm a nih,” a ta.

en: When Jesus had thus said, he was troubled in the spirit, and testified, and said, Verily, verily, I say unto you, that one of you shall betray me.
hmr: Isûn chuong anga a hril zo chun, a lungrilin a lunginzîng a, “Titak- zetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, nangni laia mi pakhatin mîn mantir a tih,” a ta, ân hriettir tah a.

en: The disciples looked one on another, doubting of whom he spake.
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chun a ti bîk an hriet nawh a, an inen tâwl a.

en: There was at the table reclining in Jesus’ bosom one of his disciples, whom Jesus loved.
hmr: Chun, a închûktirhai laia mi pakhat, Isûn a ihmangai chu, dawkân sîrah Isu ângsûnga bawkin a um a.

en: Simon Peter therefore beckoneth to him, and saith unto him, Tell us who it is of whom he speaketh.
hmr: Chun, Simon Peterin ama kuoma chun, “Tu thu tak am a na a hril, indawn ta,” tiin zaizirin a biek a.

en: He leaning back, as he was, on Jesus’ breast saith unto him, Lord, who is it?
hmr: Ama chu a umna ngaiah a um a, Isu âwm hnengin a hung thleh a, a kuomah, “Lalpa, tu tak am a na?” a ta.

en: Jesus therefore answereth, He it is, for whom I shall dip the sop, and give it him. So when he had dipped the sop, he taketh and giveth it to Judas, the son of Simon Iscariot.
hmr: Chun, Isûn “Bei hlek inchiepêk ka ta, ka ipêk chu nîng a tih,” a ta, a dawn a. Chuongchun, bei hlek chu ân chie hnungin a lâk a, Iskariot Simon naupa Juda kuoma chun a pêk a.

en: And after the sop, then entered Satan into him. Jesus therefore saith unto him, What thou doest, do quickly.
hmr: Chun, bei hlek chu a pêk hnung- in a sûngah Setan chu a lût nghâl tah a. Chuongchun, Isûn a kuomah, “I thaw ding chu thaw vak rawh,” a ta.

en: Now no man at the table knew for what intent he spake this unto him.
hmr: (Chun, dawkân kiltuhai tu- khawmin iengtiziea ti am a ni an hriet nawh a.

en: For some thought, because Judas had the bag, that Jesus said unto him, Buy what things we have need of for the feast; or, that he should give something to the poor.
hmr: Ṭhenkhatin “Juda chun tangka ip a kawl leiin, Isûn ‘Ruoiṭhenaa ding thil ei mamawhai inchaw rawh,’ a ti amanih, ‘Pasiehai kuoma iengkhat pêk ding,’ a ti amanih,” an ti a nih.)

en: He then having received the sop went out straightway: and it was night.
hmr: Chun, ama chun bei hlek chu a lâk a, a suok nghâl tah a; chu lai hun chu zân a nih.

en: When therefore he was gone out, Jesus saith, Now is the Son of man glorified, and God is glorified in him;
hmr: Chuongchun, a suok hnung chun Isûn a hril a, “Tuhin chu Mihriem Naupa chawimawiin a um tah, ama leiin Pathien khawm chawimawiin a um a nih.

en: and God shall glorify him in himself, and straightway shall he glorify him.
hmr: Pathien chu amaah chawi- mawiin a um chun, Pathien khawmin amaa chun ama chu chawimawi a tih, chawimawi nghâl a tih.

en: Little children, yet a little while I am with you. Ye shall seek me: and as I said unto the Jews, Whither I go, ye cannot come; so now I say unto you.
hmr: Nauhai, sâwt nawtê in kuomah ka la um hri hi, nangnîn mi zawng in ta; chun, Judahai kuoma, ‘Ka fena dingah hung thei naw ti niu,’ ti ka hril ang khan, tuhin chuong ang bawk chun in kuomah ka hril hi.

en: A new commandment I give unto you, that ye love one another; even as I have loved you, that ye also love one another.
hmr: “Thupêk thar ka pêk cheu hi, inhmangai tuo unla; keiin ka hma- ngai ang cheu hin, nangni khawm inhmangai tuo ro.

en: By this shall all men know that ye are my disciples, if ye have love one to another.
hmr: In inhmangai tuo chun mi po poin ka închûktirhai in ni ti chutaka chun hrieng an tih,” a ta.

en: Simon Peter saith unto him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered, Whither I go, thou canst not follow me now; but thou shalt follow afterwards.
hmr: Simon Peterin a kuomah, “Lalpa, khâwlai am i fe ding a na?” a ta. Isûn, “Ka fena dingah nangnîn tuhin mi zui thei naw ti niu; nakie pha ruok chu mi zui in tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Peter saith unto him, Lord, why cannot I follow thee even now? I will lay down my life for thee.
hmr: Peterin a kuomah, “Lalpa, iengdingin am tu khawm hin zui thei nâwng ka ti cheh a? Nangma leiin ka hringna pêng ka tih,” a ta.

en: Jesus answereth, Wilt thou lay down thy life for me? Verily, verily, I say unto thee, The cock shall not crow, till thou hast denied me thrice.
hmr: Isûn, “Keima leiin i hringna i pêk ding maw? Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril che hi, nangin vawi thum i mîn phat hmakhat chu âr khuong naw ni.

en: Let not your heart be troubled: believe in God, believe also in me.
hmr: “In lungril lunginzîng naw raw se; Pathien in ring, kei khawm mi ring ve ro.

en: In my Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you; for I go to prepare a place for you.
hmr: Ka Pa inah umna tamtak a um a, a um naw chun ka hril ta ding cheu a nih; in ta dingin hmun siemin ka fe ding a nih.

en: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I come again, and will receive you unto myself; that where I am, there ye may be also.
hmr: Chun, in ta dinga hmun ka hang siem chun hung kîr nâwk ka ta, ka kuomah lâng ka ti cheu; ka umnaah nangni khawm in um theina dingin.

en: And whither I go, ye know the way.
hmr: Ka fena ding a lampui chin in hriet ie,” a ta.

en: Thomas saith unto him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest; how know we the way?
hmr: Thoman a kuomah, “Lalpa, i fena ding chin kan hriet naw annaw, a lam- pui iengtin am hrieng kan ta?” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, I am the way, and the truth, and the life: no one cometh unto the Father, but by me.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Kei hi lampui le thutak le hringna ka nih; keimaa fe naw chu tukhawm Pa kuom an tlung ngai nawh.

en: If ye had known me, ye would have known my Father also: from henceforth ye know him, and have seen him.
hmr: Kei mi hrie ni unla chu, ka Pa khawm in hriet ta ding bah; tuta inthawk chu ama in hriet tah, ama in hmu ta bawk,” a ta.

en: Philip saith unto him, Lord, show us the Father, and it sufficeth us.
hmr: Philipin a kuomah, “Lalpa, Pa chu keini mîn hmutir ta la, chuongchun, kan ta dingin hun a tih,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Have I been so long time with you, and dost thou not know me, Philip? he that hath seen me hath seen the Father; how sayest thou, Show us the Father?
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Philip, hi chen rau hi in kuomah ka um a, chuong khawm chun in mi la hriet naw ta rawp maw? Tûkhawm a mi hmu chu Pa hmu a nih. ‘Pa chu mîn hmutir rawh,’ ieng ti tia ti am i na?

en: Believest thou not that I am in the Father, and the Father in me? the words that I say unto you I speak not from myself: but the Father abiding in me doeth his works.
hmr: Kei Paa ka um le, Pa keimaah a um ti in awi naw a ni? In kuoma thu ka hril hi keia phuokfâwmin ka hril nawh; Pa keimaah a um zing a, a thil a thaw lem hlak a nih.

en: Believe me that I am in the Father, and the Father in me: or else believe me for the very works’ sake.
hmr: Kei Paa ka um le keimaa Pa a um ti hi mi ring ro; annawleh, thilthaw lei bêk hin mi ring ro.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that believeth on me, the works that I do shall he do also; and greater works than these shall he do; because I go unto the Father.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, tûkhawmin a mi ring chun thil ka thawhai hi ama khawmin thaw vêng a tih; hieng nêka thil ropui khawm hi la thaw bawk a tih, Pa kuoma ka fe ding leiin.

en: And whatsoever ye shall ask in my name, that will I do, that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
hmr: Chun, keia hminga iengkhawm in hni taphawt chu, thaw pei ka tih, Pa, Naupa leia chawimawia a um theina dingin.

en: If ye shall ask anything in my name, that will I do.
hmr: Nangnîn keia hmingin ieng- khawm in mi hni chun, chu chu thaw pei ka tih.

en: If ye love me, ye will keep my commandments.
hmr: “Nangnîn in mi hmangai chun, ka thupêkhai chu zâwm in tih.

en: And I will pray the Father, and he shall give you another Comforter, that he may be with you for ever,
hmr: Chun, Pa hnîng ka ta, ama chun Thlamuongtu dang pêng a ti cheu, chatuona in kuoma um dingin;

en: even the Spirit of truth: whom the world cannot receive; for it beholdeth him not, neither knoweth him: ye know him; for he abideth with you, and shall be in you.
hmr: chu chu Thlarau indiktak a nih; khawvêlin chu chu an nei thei nawh, ama an hmu nawh a, an hriet bawk naw leiin. Nangnîn ama chu in hriet, in kuomah a um zing lei le, nangniah a um ding leiin.

en: I will not leave you desolate: I come unto you.
hmr: Fahrain fe san naw ning cheu; in kuomah hung nâwk ka tih.

en: Yet a little while, and the world beholdeth me no more; but ye behold me: because I live, ye shall live also.
hmr: Sâwt nawtê hnungah khaw- vêlin mi hmu nâwk ta naw ni, nisienlakhawm, nangni chun mi hmûng in tih; kei ka hring leiin nangni khawm hring in tih.

en: In that day ye shall know that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.
hmr: Chu nia chun kei ka Paa ka um dâm, nangni keimaa in um dâm, kei nangnia ka um dâm hre tâng in tih.

en: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me: and he that loveth me shall be loved of my Father, and I will love him, and will manifest myself unto him.
hmr: Tukhawm ka thupêkhai nei a, zâwm chu a mi hmangaitu a nih; tûkhawm a mi hmangai chu, ka Pain hmangai a tih, kei khawmin ama chu hmangai ka tih, a kuomah inlâr rawp ka tih,” a ta.

en: Judas (not Iscariot) saith unto him, Lord, what is come to pass that thou wilt manifest thyself unto us, and not unto the world?
hmr: Chun, Juda (Iskariot naw lem) chun a kuomah, “Lalpa, keini kuomah inlâr i ta, khawvêl kuoma în lâr naw ding chu iengdinga?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto him, If a man love me, he will keep my word: and my Father will love him, and we will come unto him, and make our abode with him.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Mîn a mi hmangai chun ka thu zâwm a ta; ka Pain ama chu hmangai a ta, a kuomah hung kan ta, a kuomah um zing kan tih.

en: He that loveth me not keepeth not my words: and the word which ye hear is not mine, but the Father’s who sent me.
hmr: Tûkhawm a mi hmangai naw chun ka thu a zâwm nawh, thu in hriethai hi ka ta a ni nawh, Pa a mi tirtu ta a ni lem.

en: These things have I spoken unto you, while yet abiding with you.
hmr: In kuoma ka la um sûng hin hieng thu hi ka hril cheu hi.

en: But the Comforter, even the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and bring to your remembrance all that I said unto you.
hmr: Chun, Thlamuongtu, Thlarau Inthieng, Pain ka hminga a hung tir ding khan, ama chun iengkim inchûktir a ti cheu a, in kuoma ka hril po po kha inhriet suoktir nâwk a ti cheu.

en: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give unto you: not as the world giveth, give I unto you. Let not your heart be troubled, neither let it be fearful.
hmr: “Thlamuongna ka mâk pêk cheu hi; keima thlamuongna ka pêk cheu a; khawvêlin a pêk ang cheuin ka pêk naw cheu hi. In lungril lunginzîng naw raw se, ṭi khawm ṭi naw raw se.

en: Ye heard how I said to you, I go away, and I come unto you. If ye loved me, ye would have rejoiced, because I go unto the Father: for the Father is greater than I.
hmr: ‘Ka fe hmang ding a na, in kuomah hung nâwk ka tih’, ka tizie cheu kha in hriet tah. Nangnîn mi hmangai ni unla Pa kuoma ka fe ding a ni leiin in lâwm ding a nih; Pa chu keia nêkin a ropui lem sih a.

en: And now I have told you before it come to pass, that, when it is come to pass, ye may believe.
hmr: Tuhin a hung tlung hma hin ka hril ta cheu hi, a hung tlung phaa in ringna dingin.

en: I will no more speak much with you, for the prince of the world cometh: and he hath nothing in me;
hmr: In kuomah thu hril nâwk mang ta naw ning, khawvêl lal a hung ding a ni sih a, ama chun keimaah iengkhawm a nei nawh,

en: but that the world may know that I love the Father, and as the Father gave me commandment, even so I do. Arise, let us go hence.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, keiin Pa ka hmangai le, Pain thu a mi pêk ang peiin thil ka thaw ti khawvêlin an hrietna ding a ni hi. Tho ro, hitaka hi suok ei tiu.

en: I am the true vine, and my Father is the husbandman.
hmr: “Kei grêp hrui tak tak ka nih, Ka Pa a huon enkawltu a nih.

en: Every branch in me that beareth not fruit, he taketh it away: and every branch that beareth fruit, he cleanseth it, that it may bear more fruit.
hmr: Ka zawmpui kâu ra naw taphawt chu a peihâwn hlak; a ra taphawt chu a sukthieng hlak, a ra tam nâwk zuolna dingin.

en: Already ye are clean because of the word which I have spoken unto you.
hmr: In kuoma ka thu hril lei chun tu khawm hin in inthieng ta pang a nih.

en: Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit of itself, except it abide in the vine; so neither can ye, except ye abide in me.
hmr: Keimaah um zing ro, kei khawm nangniah um zing ka tih. Kâu chu grêp hruiah a um zing naw chun a khâtin a ra thei naw ang bawkin, nangni khawm keimaah in um zing naw chun ra thei naw ti niu.

en: I am the vine, ye are the branches: He that abideth in me, and I in him, the same beareth much fruit: for apart from me ye can do nothing.
hmr: Kei grêp hrui chu ka nih, nangni a kâuhai chu in nih, tûkhawm keimaa a um zing a, kei khawm amaa ka um zingna chu, ama chu tamtakin a ra hlak; ka ṭhang naw chun iengkhawm in thaw thei si nawh.

en: If a man abide not in me, he is cast forth as a branch, and is withered; and they gather them, and cast them into the fire, and they are burned.
hmr: Mi keimaah a um zing naw chun kâu anga peihâwnin a um a, a vuoi hlak; chun, an inkhâwm a, meiah an pei a, a kâng hlak.

en: If ye abide in me, and my words abide in you, ask whatsoever ye will, and it shall be done unto you.
hmr: Nangni keimaa in um zing a, ka thu nangnia a um zing chun, in dit dit hni ro, in ta dingin thawin um pei a tih.

en: Herein is my Father glorified, that ye bear much fruit; and so shall ye be my disciples.
hmr: Hi hi leiin ka Pa chu chawi- mawiin a um hlak, tamtaka in ra hin; chuongchun, ka închûktirhai nîng in tih.

en: Even as the Father hath loved me, I also have loved you: abide ye in my love.
hmr: “Pain a mi hmangai ang bawkin kei khawmin ka hmangai cheu hi; ka ihmangaiin um zing ro.

en: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall abide in my love; even as I have kept my Father’s commandments, and abide in his love.
hmr: Nangnîn ka thupêkhai in zâwm chun ka ihmangaiin um zing in tih; keiin ka Pa thupêkhai ka zâwm a, a ihmangaia ka um zing ang bawk hin.

en: These things have I spoken unto you, that my joy may be in you, and that your joy may be made full.
hmr: Ka lâwm nangnia a um zingna ding le, in lâwm a kimna dingin hieng thu hi in kuomah ka hril hi.

en: This is my commandment, that ye love one another, even as I have loved you.
hmr: Hi hi ka thupêk a nih, keiin ka hmangai cheu ang bawkin, nangni inhmangai unla.

en: Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
hmr: Mihriemin a ruol ta dinga a hringna a pêk nêka hmangaina nasa lem tukhawmin an nei nawh.

en: Ye are my friends, if ye do the things which I command you.
hmr: Thu ka pêk taphawt cheu in thaw chun, ka ruolhai nîng in tih.

en: No longer do I call you servants; for the servant knoweth not what his lord doeth: but I have called you friends; for all things that I heard from my Father I have made known unto you.
hmr: Suok ti nâwk ta naw ning cheu; a pu thilthaw suok chun a hriet si nawh; ruolhai ka ti ta lem cheu a nih. Pa kuoma inthawka thil ka hriet po po in kuomah ka puong ta sih a.

en: Ye did not choose me, but I chose you, and appointed you, that ye should go and bear fruit, and that your fruit should abide: that whatsoever ye shall ask of the Father in my name, he may give it you.
hmr: Nangnîn in mi thlang nawh a, keiin ka thlang lem cheu a, va ra ding le in ra chu um zing dingin ka ruot bawk cheu a nih; ka hminga Pa kuoma in hni taphawt a pêkna ding cheuin.

en: These things I command you, that ye may love one another.
hmr: In inhmangai theina dingin hieng thu hi ka pêk cheu a nih.

en: If the world hateth you, ye know that it hath hated me before it hated you.
hmr: “Khawvêlin a theida cheu chun, a theida hma cheu khawmin kei a mi theida tah ti hre ro.

en: If ye were of the world, the world would love its own: but because ye are not of the world, but I chose you out of the world, therefore the world hateth you.
hmr: Nangni khawvêla mi ni unla, khawvêlin amaa mi a hmangai ding bah; khawvêla mi in ni si nawh a, khawvêla inthawka ka thlang suok lem cheu leiin, khawvêlin a theida cheu a nih.

en: Remember the word that I said unto you, A servant is not greater than his lord. If they persecuted me, they will also persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.
hmr: ‘Suok a pu nêkin a ropui nawh,’ ti thu ka hril ta cheu kha hre zing ro. Annîn kei an mi suknawmna ta chun, nangni khawm suknawmnâng an ti cheu; ka thu an zâwm ta chun nangni thu khawm zâwm an tih.

en: But all these things will they do unto you for my name’s sake, because they know not him that sent me.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hieng thil po po hi ka hming leiin in chungah thâwng an tih, keia mi tirtu an hriet naw leiin.

en: If I had not come and spoken unto them, they had not had sin: but now they have no excuse for their sin.
hmr: Kei hungin an kuomah thu hril naw lang chu suol an nei naw ding bah; tu ruok hin chu an suol suonlam ding an nei ta naw a nih.

en: He that hateth me hateth my Father also.
hmr: Tûkhawm kei mi theida chun ka Pa khawm a theida a nih.

en: If I had not done among them the works which none other did, they had not had sin: but now have they both seen and hated both me and my Father.
hmr: Thil, mi dang tukhawm ithaw ngainawhai anni lai thaw naw lang chu, suol an nei naw ding bah; tu ruok hin chu annîn kei le ka Pa kan pahniin an mi hmu tah a, theida khawm an mi theida tah a nih.

en: But this cometh to pass, that the word may be fulfilled that is written in their law, They hated me without a cause.
hmr: Ieng khawm ni sien, an Dân Lekhabuah, ‘Annîn a san boin an mi theida,’ ti thu ziek kha, a hung tlungna dingin an thaw a ni hi.

en: But when the Comforter is come, whom I will send unto you from the Father, even the Spirit of truth, which proceedeth from the Father, he shall bear witness of me:
hmr: “Chun, ka Pa kuoma inthawka Thlamuongtu in kuoma ka hung tir ding, Paa suok Thlarau indiktak chu, a hung tlung pha, ama chun ka thu inhriettir a tih;

en: and ye also bear witness, because ye have been with me from the beginning.
hmr: nangni khawmin inhriettir bawk in tih, a tîra inthawk ka kuoma in um leiin.

en: These things have I spoken unto you, that ye should not be caused to stumble.
hmr: “Sukthlûka in um nawna dingin hieng thu hi in kuomah ka hril ta hi.

en: They shall put you out of the synagogues: yea, the hour cometh, that whosoever killeth you shall think that he offereth service unto God.
hmr: Inkhâwmna inahai inhnawngtir an ti cheu a, anih, tûkhawm a sukhlum dinghai po cheuin Pathien chungah thilṭha thawin inhrieng an tih, chuong ang hun chu a tlung ding a nih.

en: And these things will they do, because they have not known the Father, nor me.
hmr: Chuong thil chu thâwng an tih, Pa le kei an mi hriet naw leiin.

en: But these things have I spoken unto you, that when their hour is come, ye may remember them, how that I told you. And these things I said not unto you from the beginning, because I was with you.
hmr: Hieng thu hi in kuomah ka hril ta hi, a hun chu a hung tlung pha, ka hril ta cheu ti in hriet nâwkna dingin. Hieng thil hi a tîra inthawk ka la hril naw hrim cheu a nih, in kuoma ka la um leiin.

en: But now I go unto him that sent me; and none of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?
hmr: Tu ruok hin chu a mi tirtu kuomah ka fe ding a nih, nangni rawi tukhawmin, ‘Khâwlai am i fe ding?’ tiin in mîn dawn si nawh.

en: But because I have spoken these things unto you, sorrow hath filled your heart.
hmr: Hieng thu hi in kuomah ka hril leiin in lungril chu lungngaiin a sip ṭeu lem tah a.

en: Nevertheless I tell you the truth: It is expedient for you that I go away; for if I go not away, the Comforter will not come unto you; but if I go, I will send him unto you.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, thu indiktak ka hril cheu hi, ka fe in ta dingin a ṭha; ka fe naw chun Thlamuongtu chu in kuomah a hung naw ding a ni sih a; kei ka fe ruok chun in kuomah hung tir ka tih.

en: And he, when he is come, will convict the world in respect of sin, and of righteousness, and of judgment:
hmr: Ama chu a hung tlung chun suol thua dâm, fel thua dâm, rorêl thua dâm khawvêl an thiemnaw inhriettir a tih;

en: of sin, because they believe not on me;
hmr: suol thua dâm thiemnaw chang an tih, kei an mi ring naw leiin,

en: of righteousness, because I go to the Father, and ye behold me no more;
hmr: fel thua dâm thiemnaw chang an tih, Pa kuomah ka fe ding a na, nangnîn in mi hmu nâwk ta naw ding lei hin;

en: of judgment, because the prince of this world hath been judged.
hmr: rorêl thua dâm thiemnaw chang an tih, hi khawvêl lal hi inthiemloa a tlûk ta leiin.

en: I have yet many things to say unto you, but ye cannot bear them now.
hmr: “In kuomah thu hril ding tamtak ka la nei ta rawp a; nisienlakhawm, tuhin chu tlin hri naw ti niu.

en: Howbeit when he, the Spirit of truth, is come, he shall guide you into all the truth: for he shall not speak from himself; but what things soever he shall hear, these shall he speak: and he shall declare unto you the things that are to come.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama Thlarau indiktak chu a hung tlung pha chun, thutak po poa chun ṭhuoi lût a ti cheu a, ama phuok fâwmin thu a hril âwm si nawh a, thu a idawng taphawt chu hril lem a tih; thil hung tlung dinghai khawm inhriettir a ti cheu.

en: He shall glorify me: for he shall take of mine, and shall declare it unto you.
hmr: Ama chun kei mi chawimawi a tih, ka taa mi lâng a ta, in kuomah ân hriettir ding cheu a ni sih a.

en: All things whatsoever the Father hath are mine: therefore said I, that he taketh of mine, and shall declare it unto you.
hmr: Pain thil a nei po po ka ta a nih; chuleiin, ‘ka taa mi lâng a ta, in kuomah inhriettir a ti cheu,’ ka ti hi.

en: A little while, and ye behold me no more; and again a little while, and ye shall see me.
hmr: “Sâwt nawtêah nangnîn kei mi hmu naw ti niu a, sâwt nawtêa bawk nangnîn kei mi hmu nâwk in tih,” a ta.

en: Some of his disciples therefore said one to another, What is this that he saith unto us, A little while, and ye behold me not; and again a little while, and ye shall see me: and, Because I go to the Father?
hmr: Chun, a închûktirhai ṭhenkhat- in, “Ei kuoma a thu hril hi ieng am a na? ‘Sâwt nawtêah nangnîn kei mi hmu naw ti niu a, sâwt nawtêa bawk nangnîn kei mi hmu nâwk in tih,’ a ti le, ‘Pa kuoma ka fe ding leiin,’ a ti hi,” an in tih a.

en: They said therefore, What is this that he saith, A little while? We know not what he saith.
hmr: Chun, anni ma chun, “Hi hi ieng am a na? ‘Sâwt nawtê,’ a ti hi. A thu hril hi a ngaina ei hriet nawh,” an ta.

en: Jesus perceived that they were desirous to ask him, and he said unto them, Do ye inquire among yourselves concerning this, that I said, A little while, and ye behold me not, and again a little while, and ye shall see me?
hmr: Chun, ama indawn an nuom ti Isûn a hriet a, an kuomah, “ ‘Sâwt nawtêah nangnîn kei mi hmu naw ti niu, sâwt nawtêa bawk nangnîn kei mi hmu nâwk in tih,’ tia hi ka thu hril hi in indawn maw?

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, that ye shall weep and lament, but the world shall rejoice: ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall be turned into joy.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, nangni in mitthli tlâng a ta, ṭap rak bawk in ta, khawvêl ruok chu lâwm an tih, nangni lungngai in ta, nisienlakhawm, in lungngai chu lâwmin inchang a tih.

en: A woman when she is in travail hath sorrow, because her hour is come: but when she is delivered of the child, she remembereth no more the anguish, for the joy that a man is born into the world.
hmr: Nuhmeiin nauha ân vawiin a lungngai hlak, a hun a tlung ta leiin, nisienlakhawm, nau a hung nei phing chun a thlaphâng chu a hriet nâwk ta ngai nawh, khawvêla mihriem hung pieng chu a lâwm leiin.

en: And ye therefore now have sorrow: but I will see you again, and your heart shall rejoice, and your joy no one taketh away from you.
hmr: Chun, tuhin nangni in lung- ngai, nisienlakhawm, hmu nâwk ka ti cheu a, in lungril lâwm a tih, in lâwm chu tukhawmin lâkpêk naw ni hai cheu.

en: And in that day ye shall ask me no question. Verily, verily, I say unto you, If ye shall ask anything of the Father, he will give it you in my name.
hmr: Chu ni chun nangnîn kei iengkhawm mîn dawn naw ti niu. Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, Pa kuomah in hni taphawt chu ka hmingin pêng a ti cheu.

en: Hitherto have ye asked nothing in my name: ask, and ye shall receive, that your joy may be made full.
hmr: Tu chen hin keia hmingin iengkhawm in la hni nawh; hni ro, chuongchun hmûng in tih, in lâwm a kimna dingin.

en: These things have I spoken unto you in dark sayings: the hour cometh, when I shall no more speak unto you in dark sayings, but shall tell you plainly of the Father.
hmr: “Chuong thu chu a thawiin in kuomah ka hril tah; a hun a tlung ding a nih, chu pha chun a thawiin in kuomah thu hril nâwk ta naw ning a, fietakin Pa chanchin hril lem ka ti cheu.

en: In that day ye shall ask in my name: and I say not unto you, that I will pray the Father for you;
hmr: Chu ni chun keia hmingin thil hnîng in ta, chun, ‘Pa kuomah keiin ngên pêk ka ti cheu,’ ka ti naw cheu a,

en: for the Father himself loveth you, because ye have loved me, and have believed that I came forth from the Father.
hmr: Pa ngeiin a hmangai si cheu a, nangnîn kei in mi hmangai a, Pathiena suok ka nih ti in ring leiin.

en: I came out from the Father, and am come into the world: again, I leave the world, and go unto the Father.
hmr: Kei Pa kuoma inthawka hung suok a, khawvêla hung ka nih; khawvêl fe san a, Pa kuoma fe nâwk ding ka nih,” a ta.

en: His disciples say, Lo, now speakest thou plainly, and speakest no dark saying.
hmr: A închûktirhaiin, “Ngai ta, tuhin chu fietakin thu i hril a, a thawi hrim hrimin i hril ta naw hi.

en: Now know we that thou knowest all things, and needest not that any man should ask thee: by this we believe that thou camest forth from God.
hmr: Nangin iengkim i hriet a, tukhawm indawn che i ngai nawh ti tuhin kan hriet tah; hi hi lei hin Pathien kuoma hung suok i ni ti kan awi ie,” an ta.

en: Jesus answered them, Do ye now believe?
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, an kuomah, “Tuhin chu in awi ta maw?

en: Behold, the hour cometh, yea, is come, that ye shall be scattered, every man to his own, and shall leave me alone: and yet I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
hmr: Ngai ro, a hun a tlung ding a ni tah, anih, a tlung zing tah, chu pha chun, mâni in sengah indar vawng in tih, keia khât chauin mi thlâthlam in tih; nisienlakhawm, Pa ka kuoma a um leiin makhât chauin ka um si nawh.

en: These things have I spoken unto you, that in me ye may have peace. In the world ye have tribulation: but be of good cheer; I have overcome the world.
hmr: Hieng thu hi in kuomah ka hril ta hi, keimaa in thlamuongna dingin. Khawvêla hin rinumin in um hlak; nisienlakhawm, thlamuong- takin um ro, keiin khawvêl ka hne tah,” a ta.

en: These things spake Jesus; and lifting up his eyes to heaven, he said, Father, the hour is come; glorify thy Son, that the Son may glorify thee:
hmr: Chuong thu chu Isûn a hril a; chun vântieng nghain, “Pa, a hun a tlung tah; i Naupa chawimawi rawh, Naupa hin a chawimawina ding chein;

en: even as thou gavest him authority over all flesh, that to all whom thou hast given him, he should give eternal life.
hmr: khânga mi po po chunga thuneia i siem khan, a kuoma i pêkhai po chu chatuona hringna a pêk theina dingin.

en: And this is life eternal, that they should know thee the only true God, and him whom thou didst send, even Jesus Christ.
hmr: Hi hi chatuona hringna a nih: nang Pathien tak chau le i tir Isu Krista hriet hi.

en: I glorified thee on the earth, having accomplished the work which thou hast given me to do.
hmr: Nangin thil thaw ding i mi pêk kha ka thaw zo tah a, khawvêla hin ka chawimawi ta che.

en: And now, Father, glorify thou me with thine own self with the glory which I had with thee before the world was.
hmr: Aw Pa, khawvêl um hmaa i kuoma mawina ka inei khan, tuhin nangma kuoma ngei mi chawimawi rawh.

en: I manifested thy name unto the men whom thou gavest me out of the world: thine they were, and thou gavest them to me; and they have kept thy word.
hmr: “Nangin khawvêla inthawka mî i mi pêkhai kuoma khan i hming ka suklang tah. Anni chu i ta an ni tah, nangin anni chu kei i mi pêk tah a, anni chun i thu an zâwm tah:

en: Now they know that all things whatsoever thou hast given me are from thee:
hmr: Nangin thil i mi pêk po po, i kuoma inthawka suok an nih ti tuhin an hriet tah.

en: for the words which thou gavest me I have given unto them; and they received them, and knew of a truth that I came forth from thee, and they believed that thou didst send me.
hmr: Nangin thu i mi pêkhai kha an kuoma ka pêk ta sih a; chuong chu an vawn a, i kuoma inthawka suok ka nih ti indiktakin an hriet tah, nangin i mi tir ti khawm an awi tah.

en: I pray for them: I pray not for the world, but for those whom thou hast given me; for they are thine:
hmr: “An ta dinga ka ngênpêk hi, khawvêl ta dinga ngênpêk ka ni nawh; nangin i mi pêkhai ta ding lemin a nih; i ta an ni si.

en: and all things that are mine are thine, and thine are mine: and I am glorified in them.
hmr: Thil po po ka ta taphawt chu i ta a nih, i ta chu ka ta a nih; anni leiin chawimawiin ka um hlak.

en: And I am no more in the world, and these are in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name which thou hast given me, that they may be one, even as we are.
