hmr: Chun, kei chu khawvêlah um ta naw ning, hienghai hi chu khaw- vêlah um an tih, kei chu i kuomah ka hung ding a ni tah. Pa Inthieng, anni chu I hmingin hum rawh, I hming mi pêk khan, eini ang bawka pumkhat an ni theina dingin.

en: While I was with them, I kept them in thy name which thou hast given me: and I guarded them, and not one of them perished, but the son of perdition; that the scripture might be fulfilled.
hmr: “An kuomah ka um sûng khan, anni chu i hmingin ka hum hlak, i hming mi pêk khan, anni chu ka vêng a, anni lai pakhat khawm an bohmang nawh, bohmang naupa naw kha chu; Lekha thu kha a hung tlungna dingin.

en: But now I come to thee; and these things I speak in the world, that they may have my joy made full in themselves.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuhin i kuom- ah ka hung ding a ni tah; khawvêlah hieng thu hi ka hril a nih, ka lâwm annia an nei kimna dingin.

en: I have given them thy word; and the world hated them, because they are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
hmr: I thu an kuomah ka pêk tah; chun, khawvêlin anni chu an theidah a, khawvêla mi an ni naw leiin, kei khawvêla mi ka ni naw ang bawkin.

en: I pray not that thou shouldest take them from the world, but that thou shouldest keep them from the evil one.
hmr: “Nangin anni chu khawvêla inthawka i lâk suok dinga ngên ka ni nawh a, mi suola inthawk chun i hum ding a nih ka ti lem a nih.

en: They are not of the world, even as I am not of the world.
hmr: Anni chu khawvêla mi an ni nawh, kei khawvêla mi ka ni naw ang bawk hin.

en: Sanctify them in the truth: thy word is truth.
hmr: Anni chu thutakin sukthieng rawh, i thu chu thutak a nih.

en: As thou didst send me into the world, even so sent I them into the world.
hmr: Nangin khawvêla kei i mi tir ang khan, kei khawmin anni chu khawvêlah ka tir hi.

en: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, that they themselves also may be sanctified in truth.
hmr: Anni leiin kân sukthieng a nih, anni khawm thutaka an inthieng theina dingin.

en: Neither for these only do I pray, but for them also that believe on me through their word;
hmr: “Hienghai ta ding chau hin ngên pêk ka ni nawh, an thu leia kei mi la hung ring dinghai ta ding khawma ngênpêk ka ni bawk ie, an rênga pumkhat an nina dingin;

en: that they may all be one; even as thou, Father, art in me, and I in thee, that they also may be in us: that the world may believe that thou didst send me.
hmr: Pa, nang keimaa i um le, kei nangmaa ka um ang bawk hin, anni khawm einia an umna dingin: nangin i mi tir ti khawvêlin an awi theina dingin.

en: And the glory which thou hast given me I have given unto them; that they may be one, even as we are one;
hmr: Chun, nangin ropuina i mi pêk kha keiin an kuomah ka pêk tah; anni chu pumkhat an nina dingin, eini pumkhat ei ni ang bawk hin;

en: I in them, and thou in me, that they may be perfected into one; that the world may know that thou didst send me, and lovedst them, even as thou lovedst me.
hmr: kei anniah, nang keimaah, anni pumkhata an um a, an famkim theina dingin, nangin kei i mi tir ti le, i mi hmangai angin anni hi i hmangai ti, khawvêlin an hriet theina dingin.

en: Father, I desire that they also whom thou hast given me be with me where I am, that they may behold my glory, which thou hast given me: for thou lovedst me before the foundation of the world.
hmr: Pa, nangin kei i mi pêkhai hi ka umnaah ka kuoma um dingin ka dit; nangin i mi pêk ka ropuina kha an hmuna dingin; leihnuoi insieng hma khawmin nangin i mi hmangai ta sih a.

en: O righteous Father, the world knew thee not, but I knew thee; and these knew that thou didst send me;
hmr: Aw Pa feltak, khawvêl chun an hriet naw cheh a, kei ruok chun ka hriet che kha, hienghai khawm hin nangin kei i mi tir ti an hriet kha.

en: and I made known unto them thy name, and will make it known; that the love wherewith thou lovedst me may be in them, and I in them.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah i hming kân hriettir a, inhriettir nâwk rawp ka tih; nangin kei i mi hmangaina kha anniah a um a, kei khawm annia ka um theina dingin,” a ta.

en: When Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Kidron, where was a garden, into which he entered, himself and his disciples.
hmr: Isûn chuong thu chu a hril zoin, a închûktirhai leh an suok a, Kidron vadung an kai a. Chu- taka chun huon a um a, chutaka chun an lût a, ama le a închûktirhai leh.

en: Now Judas also, who betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus oft-times resorted thither with his disciples.
hmr: Chun, ân mantirtu ding Juda khawm chun chu hmun chu a hriet; Isu a închûktirhai leh chutaka chun a lêng rawp leiin.

en: Judas then, having received the band of soldiers, and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
hmr: Chuongchun, Juda chun sipai pâwl leh, thiempu lalhai le Pharisaihai kuoma um manmihai leh a ṭhuoi a, khâwnvarhai, meiserhai, hriemhai chawiin chutaka chun an hung a.

en: Jesus therefore, knowing all the things that were coming upon him, went forth, and saith unto them, Whom seek ye?
hmr: Isûn a chunga thil tlung ding po po chu a hriet zing a, a va suok a, an kuomah, “Tu am in zawng a?” a ta.

en: They answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I am he. And Judas also, who betrayed him, was standing with them.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Nazareth Isu,” an ta, an dawn a. Isûn an kuom- ah, “Kei hi ka nih,” a ta. Chun, ân mantirtu Juda khawm chu anni lai a ngîr a.

en: When therefore he said unto them, I am he, they went backward, and fell to the ground.
hmr: Isûn, “Kei hi ka nih,” a ti phing- leh, hnungtieng an intâwl a, hnuoiah an tlu tâwl a.

en: Again therefore he asked them, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.
hmr: Isu chun an kuomah, “Tu am in zawng a?” a ti nâwk a. Anni chun, “Nazareth Isu,” an ta.

en: Jesus answered, I told you that I am he; if therefore ye seek me, let these go their way:
hmr: Chun, Isûn, “Kei hi ka nih ti ka hril cheu annâwm, nangnîn kei in mi zawng chun, hienghai hi inthla ṭha ro,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: that the word might be fulfilled which he spake, Of those whom thou hast given me I lost not one.
hmr: (A thu hril, “Nangin kei i mi pêkhai pakhat khawm kân hmang nawh,” a ti kha a tlungna dingin.)

en: Simon Peter therefore having a sword drew it, and struck the high priest’s servant, and cut off his right ear. Now the servant’s name was Malchus.
hmr: Chun, Simon Peterin kâwl- hnâm a kawl a, a phawi a, Thiempu Laltak suok a sât a, a nakâwr changtieng a sât thlâkpêk a. Suokpa hming chu Malka a nih.

en: Jesus therefore said unto Peter, Put up the sword into the sheath: the cup which the Father hath given me, shall I not drink it?
hmr: Chuongchun, Isûn Peter kuom- ah, “Kâwlhnâm kha a bâwmah thun rawh; Pain no, kei a mi pêk hi ka dâwn naw ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: So the band and the chief captain, and the officers of the Jews, seized Jesus and bound him,
hmr: Chuongchun, sipai pâwl leh, an hotu laltak leh, Judahai manmihai le chun Isu an man a, an khuop a,

en: and led him to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.
hmr: Ana kuomah an ṭhuoi hmasah a, Kaiapha tarpupa a ni leiin, Kaiapha chu, chu kum chun Thiempu Laltak a nih.

en: Now Caiaphas was he that gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
hmr: Kaiapha chu, “Mi po po aia mi pakhat thi a ṭha,” tia Judahai rawtpuitu kha a nih.

en: And Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple. Now that disciple was known unto the high priest, and entered in with Jesus into the court of the high priest;
hmr: Chun, Simon Peterin Isu a zui a, a închûktir dang pakhat leh. Chu inchûktir chu Thiempu Laltak hmêlhriet a na, Thiempu Laltak in inhuon sûng tuolah Isu kuomah a lût veh a,

en: but Peter was standing at the door without. So the other disciple, who was known unto the high priest, went out and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, Peter chu tuol- ah kawtkhâr bulah a ngir zing a. Chuongchun, inchûktir dang, Thiem- pu Laltak hmêlhriet chu, a va suok a, kawtkhâr vêngtu a biek a, Peter a ṭhuoi lût a.

en: The maid therefore that kept the door saith unto Peter, Art thou also one of this man’s disciples? He saith, I am not.
hmr: Chun, kawtkhâr vêngtu nu- nghâk chun Peter kuomah, “Nang khawm hi mipa inchûktir laia ṭhang ve i ni maw?” a ta. Ama chun, “Ka ni nawh,” a ta.

en: Now the servants and the officers were standing there, having made a fire of coals; for it was cold; and they were warming themselves: and Peter also was with them, standing and warming himself.
hmr: Chun, suokhai le manmihai chu chutaka chun an ngîr tâwl a, a dei leiin meihawlin mei an sêm a, a lum an awi a, Peter khawm anni lai a ṭhang a, ngîr pumin mei lum a awi veh a.

en: The high priest therefore asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his teaching.
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak chun Isu chu a inchûktirhai chanchin le a închûktirzie chanchin ân dawn a.

en: Jesus answered him, I have spoken openly to the world; I ever taught in synagogues, and in the temple, where all the Jews come together; and in secret spake I nothing.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Khawvêl kuomah, tlâng hrietah thu ka hril hlak kha; inkhâwmna in le, Pathien biekin, Juda po po um khâwmnaahai chun, kân chûktir rawp hlak kha, iengkhawm inrûkin ka hril nawh.

en: Why askest thou me? ask them that have heard me, what I spake unto them: behold, these know the things which I said.
hmr: Iengdinga kei i mîn dawn am? An kuomah ka thu hrilzie chu ka thu hretuhai indawn rawh; ngai rawh, chuonghai chun ka thu hril chu an hriet annâwm,” a ta.

en: And when he had said this, one of the officers standing by struck Jesus with his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?
hmr: Chu chu a hril phingleh, a kâwla ngîr manmi pakhatin Isu a ben a, “Thiempu Laltak hieng ang hin i dawn maw?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered him, If I have spoken evil, bear witness of the evil: but if well, why smitest thou me?
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Thu suol ka hril leh, ka suolna mîn hriettir rawh, nisienlakhawm, thu ṭha ka hril khawmin iengdinga i mi ben am?” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Annas therefore sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.
hmr: Chun, Ana chun khuop pumin Thiempu Laltak Kaiapha kuomah a tir a.

en: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said therefore unto him, Art thou also one of his disciples? He denied, and said, I am not.
hmr: Chun, Simon Peterin ngîrin mei lum a awi a. Chun, “Nang khawm a inchûktir laia ṭhang ve i ni maw?” an ta. Ama chun, “Ka ni nawh,” tiin ân phah a.

en: One of the servants of the high priest, being a kinsman of him whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?
hmr: Chun, Thiempu Laltak suok pakhat, Peterin a nakâwr a sât thlâk pêkpa laibungpa chun, “A kuomah huona khan ka hmu naw che am a nih?” a ta.

en: Peter therefore denied again: and straightway the cock crew.
hmr: Chuongchun, Peter ân pha nâwk a, âr a khuong tah a.

en: They lead Jesus therefore from Caiaphas into the Prætorium: and it was early; and they themselves entered not into the Prætorium, that they might not be defiled, but might eat the passover.
hmr: Chun, Isu chu Kaiapha ina inthawk chun lal inah an ṭhuoi nâwk a. Zingkâr a na; chun anni chu lal inah an lût nawh, chuong naw chun, inthieng naw nîng an ta, Fekân Ruoiṭhe fa thei naw ni hai.

en: Pilate therefore went out unto them, and saith, What accusation bring ye against this man?
hmr: Chun, Pilat an kuomah a va suok a, an kuomah, “Hi mipa chunga hin thupawi ieng am in nei a?” a ta.

en: They answered and said unto him, If this man were not an evil-doer, we should not have delivered him up unto thee.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Hi mipa hi mi suol ni naw sien chu i kuomah hung ṭhuoi naw ning ungah,” an ta, an dawn a.

en: Pilate therefore said unto them, Take him yourselves, and judge him according to your law. The Jews said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:
hmr: Pilat chun an kuomah, “Nangnîn ṭhuoi unla, in dân angin a thu rêl ro,” a ta. Judahai chun a kuomah, “Keini thu chun tukhawm sukhlum dân a ni nawh,” an ta.

en: that the word of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying by what manner of death he should die.
hmr: (A thizie ding thu, Isûn a hril anga, a tlungna dingin).

en: Pilate therefore entered again into the Prætorium, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilat chu a inah a lût nâwk a. Isu a ko a, a kuomah, “Judahai lal i ni maw?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered, Sayest thou this of thyself, or did others tell it thee concerning me?
hmr: Isûn “Hihi nanga lungril puoksuoka i hril am a ni, mi dangin an hril che, ka chunga thu hi?” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Pilate answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?
hmr: Pilatin, “Kei Juda am ka nih? nangma chihai le thiempu lalhaiin ka kuomah an hung ṭhuoi che a ni hi, thil ieng am i thaw hrim leh?” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world: if my kingdom were of this world, then would my servants fight, that I should not be delivered to the Jews: but now is my kingdom not from hence.
hmr: Isûn, “Ka ram chu hi khawvêla mi hi a ni nawh; ka ram chu hi khawvêla mi hi ni sienla, ka rawi- haiin thâwng an tih, Judahai laia pêka ka um nawna dingin; nisienlakhawm, ka ram chu hitaka mi hi a ni nawh,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Pilate therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou sayest that I am a king. To this end have I been born, and to this end am I come into the world, that I should bear witness unto the truth. Every one that is of the truth heareth my voice.
hmr: Chun, Pilatin a kuomah, “Chu lal i ni am a nih?” a ta. Isûn, “Lal ka nizie i hril zing chu. Thutak inhriettir hi ka pieng san le khawvêla ka hung san a nih. Tukhawm thutaka mi taphawt chun ka thu an pawm hlak,” a ta.

en: Pilate saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find no crime in him.
hmr: Pilatin a kuomah, “Thutak chu ieng am a na?” a ta. Chun, chu thu chu a hril phingleh, Judahai kuomah a va suok nâwk a, an kuomah, “Iengkhawm a suol ka hmu nawh.

en: But ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Fekân Ruoi- ṭheah mi pakhat kân suopêk ding cheuin dân in nei; chuongchun, Judahai lal hi insuopêk lang cheu in nuom am?” a ta.

en: They cried out therefore again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
hmr: Chun, anni chu an khêk nâwk a, “Hi mipa hi chu ni naw raw se, Barabba kha ni lem raw se,” an ta. Barabba chu suomhmang a nih.

en: Then Pilate therefore took Jesus, and scourged him.
hmr: Chun, chuong lai chun Pilatin Isu a ṭhuoi a, a vuok a.

en: And the soldiers platted a crown of thorns, and put it on his head, and arrayed him in a purple garment;
hmr: Chun, sipaihai chun hling lukhum an phier a, an inkhumtir a, puon sen duk an insiltir bawk a,

en: and they came unto him, and said, Hail, King of the Jews! and they struck him with their hands.
hmr: chun, a kuomah an hung a, “Chibai, Judahai Lal,” an ta, an ben a.

en: And Pilate went out again, and saith unto them, Behold, I bring him out to you, that ye may know that I find no crime in him.
hmr: Pilat chu a suok nâwk a, an kuomah, “En ta u, iengkhawm a suol ka hmu nawh ti in hrietna dingin in kuomah ka hung ṭhuoi suok hi,” a ta.

en: Jesus therefore came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple garment. And Pilate saith unto them, Behold, the man!
hmr: Chun, Isu chu hling lukhum le puon sen duk chu sil pumin a hung suok a. Chun, Pilatin an kuomah, “En ta u, mihriempa hi,” a ta.

en: When therefore the chief priests and the officers saw him, they cried out, saying, Crucify him, crucify him! Pilate saith unto them, Take him yourselves, and crucify him: for I find no crime in him.
hmr: Chun, thiempu lalhai le manmi- hai chun ama an hmu phingleh an khêk a, “Krawsah hemde rawh, krawsah hemde rawh,” an ta. Pilatin an kuomah, “Nangnîn fepui unla, krawsah hemde ro; kei chu ieng khawm a suolna ka hmu si nawh,” a ta.

en: The Jews answered him, We have a law, and by that law he ought to die, because he made himself the Son of God.
hmr: Judahai chun a kuomah, “Kan dân kawng khat a um, chu dân ang peiin Pathien Naua ân siem leiin, a thi ding a nih,” an ta, an dawn a.

en: When Pilate therefore heard this saying, he was the more afraid;
hmr: Pilatin chu thu chu a hrietin a ṭi nâwk zuol a;

en: and he entered into the Prætorium again, and saith unto Jesus, Whence art thou? But Jesus gave him no answer.
hmr: a inah a lût nâwk a, Isu kuomah, “Khâwtienga mi am I nih a?” a ta. Nisienlakhawm, Isûn a dawn nawh.

en: Pilate therefore saith unto him, Speakest thou not unto me? knowest thou not that I have power to release thee, and have power to crucify thee?
hmr: Chun, Pilatin a kuomah, “Nangin kei i mi biek naw vei maw? Inthla thei che ka nih, krawsa hemde thei che ka nih ti i hriet naw am a nih?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered him, Thou wouldest have no power against me, except it were given thee from above: therefore he that delivered me unto thee hath greater sin.
hmr: Isûn, “Chungtienga inthawka pêk i ni naw chun, ka chunga hin thaw thei hrim hrim nei naw ti ni; chuleiin, i kuoma mi petu khan suol a phur zuol a nih,” a ta.

en: Upon this Pilate sought to release him: but the Jews cried out, saying, If thou release this man, thou art not Cæsar’s friend: every one that maketh himself a king speaketh against Cæsar.
hmr: Chun, chu chena inthawk chu Pilatin inthla a tum a, nisien- lakhawm, Judahai an khêk a, “Hi mipa hi în thla chun Kaisar ruolpa ni naw ti ni, tûkhawm lala insiem taphawt chu Kaisar do an nih,” an ta.

en: When Pilate therefore heard these words, he brought Jesus out, and sat down on the judgment-seat at a place called The Pavement, but in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
hmr: Chun, Pilatin chuong thu chu a hriet phingleh Isu a ṭhuoi suok a, a hming Lungrem, Hebrai ṭawng chun Gabbatha an ta, chu hmuna chun rorêlna ṭhungphaah a ṭhung a.

en: Now it was the Preparation of the passover: it was about the sixth hour. And he saith unto the Jews, Behold, your King!
hmr: (Chun, chu ni chu Fekân Ruoiṭhe Inringlâwk ni a nih, nisa inding vêl a nih.) Chun, ama chun Judahai kuomah, “En ta u, in Lal hi,” a ta.

en: They therefore cried out, Away with him, away with him, crucify him! Pilate saith unto them, Shall I crucify your King? The chief priests answered, We have no king but Cæsar.
hmr: Chun, anni chu an khêk a, “Sukbohmang rawh, sukbohmang rawh, krawsah hemde rawh,” an ta. Pilatin an kuomah, “In lal hi krawsah hemdêng ka ti maw?” a ta. Thiempu Lalhaiin, “Kaisar naw chu lal dang kan nei nawh,” an ta, an dawn a.

en: Then therefore he delivered him unto them to be crucified.
hmr: Chuongchun, Pilatin krawsa hemde dingin ama chu an kuomah a pêk tah a.

en: They took Jesus therefore: and he went out, bearing the cross for himself, unto the place called The place of a skull, which is called in Hebrew Golgotha:
hmr: Chuongchun, Isu chu an ṭhuoi tah a. Ama chun mâni ta dinga kraws putin, “Lu ru hmun,” an ti, Hebrai ṭawng chun Golgotha an ti, chu hmun chen chun a va suok a.

en: where they crucified him, and with him two others, on either side one, and Jesus in the midst.
hmr: Chutaka chun ama chu krawsah an hemdeh a, mi dang pahni khawm krawsah an hemde bawk a, a sîr tuokah pakhat ve vein, a laiah Isu.

en: And Pilate wrote a title also, and put it on the cross. And there was written, JESUS OF NAZARETH, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
hmr: Chun, Pilatin lekha a ziek a, kraws lêr tieng a bel a, “NAZARETH ISU JUDAHAI LAL,” tiin ziek a nih.

en: This title therefore read many of the Jews, for the place where Jesus was crucified was nigh to the city; and it was written in Hebrew, and in Latin, and in Greek.
hmr: Chu lekha chu Judahai a ṭhen tamtakin an tiem a; Isu krawsa an hemdena hmun chu khawpui kâwl a na, Hebrai ṭawng dâm, Rom ṭawng dâm, Grik ṭawng dâmin ziek a nih.

en: The chief priests of the Jews therefore said to Pilate, Write not, The King of the Jews; but, that he said, I am King of the Jews.
hmr: Chuongchun, Judahai thiempu lalhai chun, Pilat kuomah “ ‘Judahai Lal,’ tiin ziek naw la, ‘Judahai Lal ka nih a tih,’ tiin ziek lem rawh,” an ta.

en: Pilate answered, What I have written I have written.
hmr: Pilat chun, “Ka ziek kha ka ziek zo tah,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: The soldiers therefore, when they had crucified Jesus, took his garments and made four parts, to every soldier a part; and also the coat: now the coat was without seam, woven from the top throughout.
hmr: Chun, sipaihaiin Isu chu krawsa an hemde zo chun, a silfênhai an lâk a, phêk liin an siem a, sipaihaiin phêk khatin an chang seng a; a zakuo an lâk bawk a. Zakuo chu ṭhuilo zakuo a na, a rînga inthawka a puma khâwng vawng a nih.

en: They said therefore one to another, Let us not rend it, but cast lots for it, whose it shall be: that the scripture might be fulfilled, which saith, They parted my garments among them, And upon my vesture did they cast lots.
hmr: Chuleiin, anni chun, “Kei thlêr nâwng ei tiu, tu ta tak ding am a na, ai sân lem ei tiu,” an in tih a, Pathien Lekha Thu, “Ka silfênhai an insem a, Ka zakuo dingin ai an sân a,” ti a tlungna dingin. Chuong thil chu sipaihaiin an thaw a nih.

en: These things therefore the soldiers did. But there were standing by the cross of Jesus his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
hmr: Chun, Isu kraws kâwlah a nu le a nu zuorpuinu Mari, Kleopa nuhmei, le Mari Magdalin an ngîr a.

en: When Jesus therefore saw his mother, and the disciple standing by whom he loved, he saith unto his mother, Woman, behold, thy son!
hmr: Chun, Isûn a nu le a inchûktir a ihmangai kha a kâwla ngir a hmuh a, a nu kuomah, “Nuhmei, en ta, i naupa kha!” a ta.

en: Then saith he to the disciple, Behold, thy mother! And from that hour the disciple took her unto his own home.
hmr: Chun, inchûktir kuoma khawm chun, “En ta, i nu kha!” a ta. Chun, chu chena inthawk chu, chu inchûktir chun amanu chu a inah a ṭhuoi tah a.

en: After this Jesus, knowing that all things are now finished, that the scripture might be accomplished, saith, I thirst.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Isûn thil iengkim tuhin a kim tah ti a hriet a, Pathien Lekha Thu kha a tlungna dingin, “Ka dang a châr ie,” a ta.

en: There was set there a vessel full of vinegar: so they put a sponge full of the vinegar upon hyssop, and brought it to his mouth.
hmr: Chutaka chun bêl pakhat uoin thûra sip an intung a, chuongchun sponj pakhat chu uoin thûra inchie sipin husop hmawlah an târ a, a hmûr an hang intlun a.

en: When Jesus therefore had received the vinegar, he said, It is finished: and he bowed his head, and gave up his spirit.
hmr: Chun, Isûn uoin thûr chu a lo dâwn zo chun, “A kin tah,” a ta. A lu a kûn a, a thlarau ân thla tah a.

en: The Jews therefore, because it was the Preparation, that the bodies should not remain on the cross upon the sabbath (for the day of that sabbath was a high day), asked of Pilate that their legs might be broken, and that they might be taken away.
hmr: Chun, Inringlâwk ni a ni leiin, ruonghai chu Châwlnia krawsa a um zing nawna dingin, (chu Châwlni chu ni ropui a ni sih a,) Judahaiin Pilat kuomah an kehai suktlieka, an ruong fepui dingin an ngên a.

en: The soldiers therefore came, and brake the legs of the first, and of the other that was crucified with him:
hmr: Chun, sipaihai chu an hung a, a kuoma krawsa an hemde a tawntira mi le mi dang chu an kehai an suktliek a.

en: but when they came to Jesus, and saw that he was dead already, they brake not his legs:
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isu kuomah an hung a, a thi ta zing ti an hriet a, a kehai an suktliek ve nawh a.

en: howbeit one of the soldiers with a spear pierced his side, and straightway there came out blood and water.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sipaihai laia mi pakhatin a nâkah feiin a sun a, chuongchun, thisen le tui a suok nghâl ta a.

en: And he that hath seen hath borne witness, and his witness is true: and he knoweth that he saith true, that ye also may believe.
hmr: A hmutu chun ân hriettir tah (a thu inhriettir chu ân dik a nih, a hril indik ti khawm a hriet,) nangni khawmin in ringna dingin.

en: For these things came to pass, that the scripture might be fulfilled, A bone of him shall not be broken.
hmr: Pathien Lekha Thu, “A ru pakhat khawm suktliek ni naw ni,” ti a tlungna dingin chuong thil chu a hung um tah a nih.

en: And again another scripture saith, They shall look on him whom they pierced.
hmr: Chun, Pathien Lekha Thu dangin “An isun ngei chu la en an tih,” a ti bawk a.

en: And after these things Joseph of Arimathæa, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away the body of Jesus: and Pilate gave him leave. He came therefore, and took away his body.
hmr: Chun, chuong thil thaw zo chun, Josef Arimathai khuoa mi, Isu inchûktir a nih, nisienlakhawm, Judahai a ṭi leiin a rûka um a na, ama chun Isu ruong chu fepui dingin Pilat kuomah a hnih a, chun Pilatin a phal a. Chuongchun, a hung a, a ruong chu a fepui tah a.

en: And there came also Nicodemus, he who at the first came to him by night, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.
hmr: Chun, Nikodem, (a tîra zâna a kuoma hung khan,) murra le aloe inpawlsa bûk sâwmnga lai chawiin a hung veh a.

en: So they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in linen cloths with the spices, as the custom of the Jews is to bury.
hmr: Chun, Isu ruong chu an lâk a, Judahai inphûm dân angin thil rim inhnikhai le chun puon zai inhmiin an tuom a.

en: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new tomb wherein was never man yet laid.
hmr: Chun, krawsa an hemdena hmuna chun huon pakhat a um a, huona chun tukhawm lân zâlna ngainaw thlân thar pakhat a um.

en: There then because of the Jews’ Preparation (for the tomb was nigh at hand) they laid Jesus.
hmr: Chun, Judahai Inringlâwk ni a ni leiin, thlân chu an kâwl el a ni sih a, chutaka chun Isu chu an inzâl tah a.

en: And the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
hmr: Chun, ni thum niah, Galili rama Kana khuoah inneina ruoiṭhe a um a, chutaka chun Isu nu a um a.

en: and Jesus also was bidden, and his disciples, to the marriage.
hmr: Isu le a închûktirhai khawm inneinaa chun an fiel a.

en: And when the wine failed, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
hmr: Chun, uoinin a dai ta nawh a, Isu nu chun a kuomah, “Uoin an tlasam tah ie,” a ta.

en: And Jesus saith unto her, Woman, what have I to do with thee? mine hour is not yet come.
hmr: Isu chun a kuomah, “Nuhmei, nanga mi lo hrietpêk ding ieng am a um a? ka hun a la tlung nawh,” a ta.

en: His mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
hmr: Chun, a nu chun rawngbâwltu- hai kuomah, “In kuoma a hril taphawt chu thaw pei ro,” a ta.

en: Now there were six waterpots of stone set there after the Jews’ manner of purifying, containing two or three firkins apiece.
hmr: Chun, Judahai inthien dân angin lung tuibêl paruk, bûk sâwmli hmun hni amanih, hmun thum amanih keng seng chutaka chun an intung a.

en: Jesus saith unto them, Fill the waterpots with water. And they filled them up to the brim.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Tuibêl- ahai tui suksip ro,” a ta. A rei inruolin an suksip seng a.

en: And he saith unto them, Draw out now, and bear unto the ruler of the feast. And they bare it.
hmr: Chun, an kuomah, “Tuhin thâl unla, ruoiṭhe hotu kuomah fepui ro,” a ta. Chun, an fepui tah a.

en: And when the ruler of the feast tasted the water now become wine, and knew not whence it was (but the servants that had drawn the water knew), the ruler of the feast calleth the bridegroom,
hmr: Chun, ruoiṭhe hotu chun tui uoina hung inchang chu ân tem a, a suokna chin a hriet nawh a, (tui thâl rawngbâwltuhai ruok chun an hriet a), nuhmei nei tupa chu a ko tah a,

en: and saith unto him, Every man setteth on first the good wine; and when men have drunk freely, then that which is worse: thou hast kept the good wine until now.
hmr: a kuomah, “Mi tinin a tirin uoin ṭha an sie suok hlak, chun, a tam deu an dâwn hnungin a ṭha naw deu chu an sie suok hlak, nang ruok chun tu chen hin uoin ṭha i la nei zing a,” a ta.

en: This beginning of his signs did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested his glory; and his disciples believed on him.
hmr: Isûn hi a thilmak thaw phutna hi Galili ram Kana khuoa chun a thaw a nih, a ropuizie ân langtir a; chun, a inchûktirhai chun ama chu an ring tah a.

en: After this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples; and there they abode not many days.
hmr: Chun, chu hnunga chun, Kaper- naumah a zu fe a, ama le a nu leh, a unauhai le, a închûktirhai leh; chutaka chun ni sâwt nawtê an um a.

en: And the passover of the Jews was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chun, Judahai Fekân Ruoiṭhe a hnai tah a, Isu Jerusalemah a hang feh a.

en: And he found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:
hmr: Chun, Pathien biekina se- bâwnghai, berâmhai, vaṭhuhai zawr- tuhai le tangka thlengtuhai ṭhung a hmuh a.

en: and he made a scourge of cords, and cast all out of the temple, both the sheep and the oxen; and he poured out the changers’ money, and overthrew their tables;
hmr: Chun, hruihruol invuokna a siem a, sebâwng le berâm an rêngin Pathien biekina inthawk chun a hnawt dawk a, tangka thlengtuhai tangka chu a bunthlâk a, an dawkânhai a nam thlûkpêk bawk a;

en: and to them that sold the doves he said, Take these things hence; make not my Father’s house a house of merchandise.
hmr: chun, vaṭhu zawrtuhai kuoma chun, “Hieng thilhai hi hitaka inthawkin fepui ro, ka Pa in sum- dâwngna inin siem naw ro,” a ta.

en: His disciples remembered that it was written, Zeal for thy house shall eat me up.
hmr: Chun, a inchûktirhai chun, “I ina ka ṭhahnemngainân mi fa zo a tih” ti ziek a nih ti an hriet nâwk tah a.

en: The Jews therefore answered and said unto him, What sign showest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
hmr: Chun, Judahaiin a kuomah, “Hieng thil i thaw hi inchikna ieng am i mîn hmutir thei a?” tiin ama an in dawn a.

en: Jesus answered and said unto them, Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.
hmr: Isûn an kuomah, “Hi in hi sukseb unla, ni thum sûngin inngîr nâwk ka tih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: The Jews therefore said, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou raise it up in three days?
hmr: Chun, Judahai chun, “Hi in hi kum sâwmli paruk sûng bâwl a nih, nangin ni thum sûngin inngîr i ti maw?” an ta.

en: But he spake of the temple of his body.
hmr: (Nisienlakhawm, a taksa in chu hril a lo ni lem sih a.

en: When therefore he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he spake this; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
hmr: Chuleiin, mithi laia inthawka a thonâwkin, chu thu chu a hril tah ti a închûktirhai chun an hriet nâwk tah a; chun, Pathien Lekha Thu le Isu thu hril chu an ring tah a).

en: Now when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, during the feast, many believed on his name, beholding his signs which he did.
hmr: Chun, Fekân Ruoiṭhea Jerusa- lema a um lai chun, a thilmak thawhai an hmuh a, mi tamtakin a hming an ring tah a.

en: But Jesus did not trust himself unto them, for that he knew all men,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isu chu anni lai a ngam nawh, mi po po a hriet a.

en: and because he needed not that any one should bear witness concerning man; for he himself knew what was in man.
hmr: Mihriem thu tukhawm ihril a ngai nawh, ama chun mihriem sûnga um taphawt chu a hriet sih a.

en: Now on the first day of the week cometh Mary Magdalene early, while it was yet dark, unto the tomb, and seeth the stone taken away from the tomb.
hmr: Chun, ni saria ni hmasatakah, zîngkâr, khuo a lân thim laiin, Mari Magdalin chu thlâna chun a va feh a, lung chu thlâna inthawka lâk sawnin a hmuh a.

en: She runneth therefore, and cometh to Simon Peter, and to the other disciple whom Jesus loved, and saith unto them, They have taken away the Lord out of the tomb, and we know not where they have laid him.
hmr: Chuongchun, a tlân a, Simon Peter le inchûktir dang Isûn a ihmangai kuoma chun a hung a, an kuomah, “Thlâna inthawk khan Lalpa chu an fe hmangpui tah, an siena chin hrim kan hriet nawh,” a ta.

en: Peter therefore went forth, and the other disciple, and they went toward the tomb.
hmr: Chuongchun, Peter chu a suok a, inchûktir dang le chun; chun, thlântieng an pan tah a.

en: And they ran both together: and the other disciple outran Peter, and came first to the tomb;
hmr: An tlân rêl a, inchûktir dang chun Peter a lekhêl a, thlân chu a tlung hmasah a.

en: and stooping and looking in, he seeth the linen cloths lying; yet entered he not in.
hmr: A kûn a, a bih a, puon zai inhmi um chu a hmuh a; nisienlakhawm, a sûngah a lût nawh.

en: Simon Peter therefore also cometh, following him, and entered into the tomb; and he beholdeth the linen cloths lying,
hmr: Chun, Simon Peter khawmin a hnungah a hung hnawt phâk a, thlân sûngah a lût a; puon zai inhmihai um le

en: and the napkin, that was upon his head, not lying with the linen cloths, but rolled up in a place by itself.
hmr: a lua inhrûkna puon um chu, puon zai inhmihai laia um loin, ziel sain hmun tuma um a hmuh a.

en: Then entered in therefore the other disciple also, who came first to the tomb, and he saw, and believed.
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktir dang, thlân tlung hmasapa khawm chu a lût veh a, a hmuh a, a awi a.

en: For as yet they knew not the scripture, that he must rise again from the dead.
hmr: Mithi laia inthawkin a thonâwk ding a ni ti Pathien Lekha Thu kha an la hriet si nawh a.

en: So the disciples went away again unto their own home.
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktirhai chu anni inah an fe nâwk tah a.

en: But Mary was standing without at the tomb weeping: so, as she wept, she stooped and looked into the tomb;
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Mari chu tuol- ah thlân kâwla chun ṭap pumin a ngîr a; chuongchun, ṭap pumin a kûn a, thlân sûng chu a bih a;

en: and she beholdeth two angels in white sitting, one at the head, and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus had lain.
hmr: chun, vântirko pahni puon vâr silin, Isu ruong inzâlna hmuna chun, pakhat a lu tieng, pakhat a ke tienga ṭhung a hmuh a.

en: And they say unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? She saith unto them, Because they have taken away my Lord, and I know not where they have laid him.
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “Nuhmei, iengdinga i ṭap am?” an ta. Ama chun an kuomah, “Ka Lalpa an fe- hmangpui a, an siena chin ka hriet naw leiin,” a ta.

en: When she had thus said, she turned herself back, and beholdeth Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.
hmr: Chun, chuonga a hril phingleh a hnung tieng a nghah a, Isu ngîr chu a hmuh a, Isu a ni ti a hriet si nawh a.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, why weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou hast borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Nuhmei, ieng- dinga i ṭap am? Tû am i zawng a?” a ta. Ama chun huon enkawltu amanih a tih a, a kuomah, “Pu, ama hitaka inthawka i fepui a ni chun i siena chin mi hril rawh, chuongchun lâng ka tih,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Mary. She turneth herself, and saith unto him in Hebrew, Rabboni; which is to say, Teacher.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Mari,” a tih a. Ama chu a nghah a, a kuomah, Hebrai ṭawngin, “Rabboni,” a ta; (chu chu Inchûktirtu tina a nih.)

en: Jesus saith to her, Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended unto the Father: but go unto my brethren, and say to them, I ascend unto my Father and your Father, and my God and your God.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Mi chel naw rawh, tu chen khawmin Pa kuomah ka la hang fe nawh; amiruokchu, ka unauhai kuomah va fe la, an kuomah, ‘Ka pa, in Pa, Ka Pathien, in Pathien kuomah ka lâwn ding a nih,’ a tih, va ti rawh,” a ta.

en: Mary Magdalene cometh and telleth the disciples, I have seen the Lord; and that he had said these things unto her.
hmr: Mari Magdalin chu a va feh a, închûktirhai kuomah, “Lalpa chu kan hmu tah,” a ta, a kuoma thu a hrilziehai khawm chu a hril a.

en: When therefore it was evening, on that day, the first day of the week, and when the doors were shut where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
hmr: Chun, chu ni, ni saria ni hmasatakah, khuo a hung inhnu chun, Judahai ṭi leia inchûktirhai umna kawtkhârhai chu khâr a ni hnungin, Isu anni lai a hung ngîr a, an kuomah, “In chungah thla- muongna um raw se,” a ta.

en: And when he had said this, he showed unto them his hands and his side. The disciples therefore were glad, when they saw the Lord.
hmr: Chu chu a hril zo chun, a kut le a nâk an kuomah ân entir a. Chun, Lalpa chu an hmu chun inchûktirhai chu an lâwm tah a.

en: Jesus therefore said to them again, Peace be unto you: as the Father hath sent me, even so send I you.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “In chungah thlamuongna um raw se, Pain kei a mi tir ang bawkin ka tir cheu hi,” a ti nâwk a.

en: And when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive ye the Holy Spirit:
hmr: Chun, chuong thu chu a hril zoin, an chungah ân thuok a, an kuomah, “Thlarau Inthieng nei ro,

en: whose soever sins ye forgive, they are forgiven unto them; whose soever sins ye retain, they are retained.
hmr: tu suol khawm in ngaidam taphawt chu ngaidam nîng a tih; tu suol khawm in ngaidam naw taphawt chu, ngaidam naw nîng a tih,” a ta.

en: But Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.
hmr: Chun, Isu a hung lai khan, sâwm le pahnihai laia ṭhang ve Thoma (Didum an ti bawk) chu an kuomah a um ve nawh a.

en: The other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and put my hand into his side, I will not believe.
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktir danghai chun a kuomah, “Lalpa chu kan hmu tah,” an ta. Nisienlakhawm, ama chun an kuomah, “A kuta thîr kilna serhai kha ka hmuh a, thîr kilna serhaia chun ka kut pârhai ka khîk lûta, a nâka ka pur meu naw chun, ring naw ning,” a ta.

en: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus cometh, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace be unto you.
hmr: Chun, ni riet hnungah, a inchûktirhai chu in sûngah an um nâwk a, Thoma khawm an kuomah a um veh a. Chun, Isu a hung a, kawthai chu khâr a ni sih a, anni lai a hung ngîr tah a, an kuomah, “In chungah thlamuongna um raw se,” a ta.

en: Then saith he to Thomas, Reach hither thy finger, and see my hands; and reach hither thy hand, and put it into my side: and be not faithless, but believing.
hmr: Chun, Thoma kuoma chun, “I kut pârin hang them la, ka kuthai en rawh; i kut hang ban la, ka nak pur rawh; ring loin um naw la, ring el rawh,” a ta.

en: Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
hmr: Thoman a kuomah, “Ka Lalpa le ka Pathien i nih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Because thou hast seen me, thou hast believed: blessed are they that have not seen, and yet have believed.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Nangin kei i mi hmu leiin i ring a ni maw? Hmu loa ring taphawthai chu an hamṭha,” a ta.

en: Many other signs therefore did Jesus in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book:
hmr: Chun, Isûn inchûktirhai hmaah inchikna dang tamtak a thaw ṭeu a, chuonghai chu hi lekhabua hin ziek a ni nawh.

en: but these are written, that ye may believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye may have life in his name.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hieng hi, Isu chu, Krista, Pathien Naupa a nih ti in ringna ding le, in ring a, a hminga hringna in neina dinga ziek a nih.

en: After these things Jesus manifested himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and he manifested himself on this wise.
hmr: Chun chu hnunga chun, Tiberi dîlah Isu a inchûktirhai kuomah ân lâr nâwk a; hieng ang hin ân lâr;

en: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.
hmr: Simon Peter hai, Thoma (Didum an ti bawk) hai, Galili rama Kana khuoa mi Nathanael hai, Zebedai naupahai pahni, a închûktirhai pahni dang leh an um khâwm a.

en: Simon Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also come with thee. They went forth, and entered into the boat; and that night they took nothing.
hmr: Simon Peter chun an kuomah, “Nga manin ka fe ding a nih,” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Keini khawm i kuomah hung vêng kan tih,” an ta. An fe suok a, lawngah an chuong a; chu zân chun iengkhawm an man nawh.

en: But when day was now breaking, Jesus stood on the beach: yet the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
hmr: Chun, khawfing chatin Isu ṭieuphoah a ngîr a; nisienlakhawm, a închûktirhai chun Isu a nih ti an hriet si nawh.

en: Jesus therefore saith unto them, Children, have ye aught to eat? They answered him, No.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Nauhai, iengkhat fâk ding in nei am?” a ta. Anni chun a kuomah, “Nei lo,” an ta, an dawn a.

en: And he said unto them, Cast the net on the right side of the boat, and ye shall find. They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “Lawng sîr changtieng khan lên dêng unla, hmûng in tih,” a ta. Chun, an dêng a, nga tam lei chun an kei dawk zo ta nawh a.

en: That disciple therefore whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. So when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his coat about him (for he was naked), and cast himself into the sea.
hmr: Chuongchun, inchûktir Isûn a ihmangai khan Peter kuomah, “Lalpa a ni saw,” a ta. Chuongchun, Lalpa a nih ti Simon Peter chun a hriet phingleh, a silfên ân bel a, (ruoka um a ni sih a,) dîlah ân châwm thla tah a.

en: But the other disciples came in the little boat (for they were not far from the land, but about two hundred cubits off), dragging the net full of fishes.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, inchûktir dang- hai chun lawng chîtê têhai chun, lên nga puma hnûk pei pum chun an hung pan a, (khawmuola inthawkin a hla si nawh a, tawng za hni amani chau a nih).

en: So when they got out upon the land, they see a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
hmr: Chun, khawmuola an suok phingleh, chutaka chun meihawla mei insêm an hmuh a, a chunga nga le beiphêk raw leh.

en: Jesus saith unto them, Bring of the fish which ye have now taken.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Tuhin in nga man kha a ṭhen hung la ro,” a ta.

en: Simon Peter therefore went up, and drew the net to land, full of great fishes, a hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, the net was not rent.
hmr: Chuongchun, Simon Peter a va chuong a, lên chu nga lien tak taka sipin khawmuolah a hnûk dawk a, za le sâwmnga le pathum a nih; chuong zât zât um sien khawm lên chu ân ek si nawh.

en: Jesus saith unto them, Come and break your fast. And none of the disciples durst inquire of him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Zîngbu hung fa ro,” a ta. Inchûktirhai laia tukhawmin a kuomah, “Tu am i na?” tiin an indawn ngam nawh, Lalpa a nih ti an hriet zing a.

en: Jesus cometh, and taketh the bread, and giveth them, and the fish likewise.
hmr: Chun, Isu a hung a, beiphêk chu a lâk a, an kuomah a pêk a, ngahai khawm chu chuong ang bawkin a pêk a.

en: This is now the third time that Jesus was manifested to the disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.
hmr: Chu chu Isu mithi laia inthawk- a a thonâwk hnunga a închûktirhai kuoma ân lâr a vawi thumna a nih.

en: So when they had broken their fast, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me more than these? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed my lambs.
hmr: Chun, zingbu an fâk zoin, Isûn Simon Peter kuomah, “Simon, Johan naupa, hienghai nêk hin nangin kei i mi hmangai lem am?” a ta. Ama chun a kuomah, “Aw, Lalpa, ka ngaina che ti I hriet,” a ta. Ama chun a kuom- ah, “Ka berâmtehai châwm rawh,” a ta.

en: He saith to him again a second time, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me? He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Tend my sheep.
hmr: A vawihninaah, a kuomah, “Simon, Johan naupa, nangin kei i mi hmangai am?” a ti nâwk a. Ama chun a kuomah, “Aw, Lalpa, ka ngaina che ti i hriet,” a ti nâwk a. Ama chun a kuomah, “Ka berâmhai enkawl rawh,” a ta.

en: He saith unto him the third time, Simon, son of John, lovest thou me? Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed my sheep.
hmr: A vawithumnaa chun, “Simon, Johan naupa, nangin kei i mi ngaina am?” a ta. Chun, a vawithumnaah “Nangin i mi ngaina am,” a kuoma a ti lei chun Peter a lungngai a, a kuomah, “Lalpa, iengkim i hriet a, ka ngaina che ti i hriet,” a ta. Isûn a kuomah, “Ka berâmhai châwm rawh.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, When thou wast young, thou girdedst thyself, and walkedst whither thou wouldest: but when thou shalt be old, thou shalt stretch forth thy hands, and another shall gird thee, and carry thee whither thou wouldest not.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril che, i naupang lai khan i kâwngah în khit a, i nuomna tieng tieng i fe hlak; nisienlakhawm, i upat pha i kuthai phar i ta, mi dangin khitpêk an ti cheh a, i nuom nawna tieng kei an ti che,” a ta.

en: Now this he spake, signifying by what manner of death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow me.
hmr: Chuong thu chu iengtiziea thiin am Pathien a chawimawi ding ti inhriettirna dingin a hril a nih. Chun, chu chu a hril zoin a kuomah, “Mi zui rawh,” a ta.

en: Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; who also leaned back on his breast at the supper, and said, Lord, who is he that betrayeth thee?
hmr: Chun, Peter chu a nghah a, Isûn inchûktir a ihmangai, zânbu fâk laia a âwm hnenga hung thlea, “ân mantirtu ding che chu tu tak am nîng a ta?” titu khan a hung zui a hmuh a.

en: Peter therefore seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
hmr: Peterin ama chu a hmu chun Isu kuomah, “Lalpa hi mipa hin ieng am thâwng a ta?” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee? follow thou me.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Ka hung nâwk chena um zing dingin dit lang lem chu, chu chu ienga i hmang ding am a na? Nangin mi zui el rawh,” a ta.

en: This saying therefore went forth among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, that he should not die; but, If I will that he tarry till I come, what is that to thee?
hmr: Chuongchun, chu inchûktir chu thi naw dingin a thu unauhai lai ân thang tah a. Nisienlakhawm, Isûn thi naw ni ti a kuomah a hril si nawh, “Ka hung nâwk chena um zing dingin dit lang lem chu, chu chu ienga i hmang ding am a na?” a ti el a ni sih a.

en: This is the disciple that beareth witness of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his witness is true.
hmr: 24 Chu inchûktir chu hieng thu ziektu le inhriettirtu hi a nih; a thu inhriettir hi indiktak a nih ti ei hriet.

en: And there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself would not contain the books that should be written.
hmr: Chun, hieng naw hi Isu thilthaw dang tamtak a la um, chuongchu ziek fai vawng ding ni sien, lekhabu ziek ding po po chu khawvêla khawm hin inlengin ka ring nawh.

en: Now there was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:
hmr: Chun, Pharisaihai laia mi, a hming Nikodem, Judahai hotu pakhat a um a;

en: the same came unto him by night, and said to him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God; for no one can do these signs that thou doest, except God be with him.
hmr: ama chu zânah Isu kuomah a hung a, a kuomah, “Rabbi, Pathiena inthawka inchûktirtua hung i ni ti kan hriet; Pathien an chungah a um naw chun hieng thilmak i thawhai hi tukhawmin thaw thei naw ni hai,” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except one be born anew, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Titak- zetin, titakzetin ka hril che hi mi tûkhawm an pieng thar naw chun, Pathien ram hmu thei naw ni hai,” a ta.

en: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?
hmr: Nikodemin a kuomah, “Mi a tar hnungin iengtin am pieng thei a ta? A nu sulah vawi hni lûtin a pieng ding am a nih?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except one be born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril che hi, mi tûkhawm tuia le Thlaraua an pieng naw chun Pathien ramah lût thei naw ni hai,

en: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
hmr: tisaa pieng taphawt tisa a nih, Thlaraua pieng taphawt chu thlarau a nih.

en: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born anew.
hmr: In pieng thar ding ka ti che hi mak ti naw rawh.

en: The wind bloweth where it will, and thou hearest the voice thereof, but knowest not whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
hmr: Thli khâwlai khawm a nuom nuomin a hrâng hlak, a ri i hriet deh, nisienlakhawm, khâwtaka inthawka hung am, khâwlai am a fe ding ti i hriet si nawh; tûkhawm Thlaraua pieng chu chuong ang chu an nih,” a ta.

en: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?
hmr: Chun, Nikodemin a dawn a, a kuomah, “Chuong thil chu iengtin am um thei a ta?” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou the teacher of Israel, and understandest not these things?
hmr: Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Israelhai inchûktirtu i ni sih a, chuong chu i hriet naw maw?

en: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that which we know, and bear witness of that which we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril che hi, keinîn kan hriet chu kan hril hlak, kan hmu chu kan inhriettir hlak; nisienlakhawm, kan thu inhriettir in awi ngai si nawh.

en: If I told you earthly things and ye believe not, how shall ye believe if I tell you heavenly things?
hmr: Khawvêla thil ka hril hmana awi lo cheu a, vâna thil hril lang cheu iengtin am awi in ta?

en: And no one hath ascended into heaven, but he that descended out of heaven, even the Son of man, who is in heaven.
hmr: Vânah tukhawm an lâwn ngai nawh, vâna inthawka hung ṭum Mihriem Naupa chau naw hi chu.

en: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up;
hmr: “Chun, Mosiein thlalêra rûl a khai kâng ang khan, Mihriem Naupa hi khai kângin a um bawk ding a nih;

en: that whosoever believeth may in him have eternal life.
hmr: tûkhawm a ring taphawt chun ama leia chatuona hringna an neina dingin.

en: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth on him should not perish, but have eternal life.
hmr: Pathienin khawvêl a hmangai bêk bêk a, chuongchun, a Naupa khât nei sun chu a pêk a, ama chu tûkhawm a ring taphawt chu an bohmang nawh a, chatuona hringna an nei lemna dingin.

en: For God sent not the Son into the world to judge the world; but that the world should be saved through him.
hmr: Khawvêl thiemnaw inchangtir dingin Pathienin a Nau khawvêlah a tir nawh, khawvêl ama leia an dam theina dingin a tir a ni lem.

en: He that believeth on him is not judged: he that believeth not hath been judged already, because he hath not believed on the name of the only begotten Son of God.
hmr: “Tûkhawm ama ring chu inthiemloin um naw ni hai, tukhawm a ring naw chu tuta inthawkin in- thiemloin an um nghâl a nih, Pathien Naupa khât nei hming an ring naw leiin.

en: And this is the judgment, that the light is come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.
hmr: Hi hi thiemnawna a nih, var khawvêlah a hung a, nisienlakhawm, mihaiin var nêkin inthim an dit lem a, an thilthawhai a suol leiin.

en: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, and cometh not to the light, lest his works should be reproved.
hmr: Tûkhawm thil suksuol taphawt chun var an theida hlak, vara khawm an hung nawh, chuong naw chun, an thilthawhai inlang a tih.

en: But he that doeth the truth cometh to the light, that his works may be made manifest, that they have been wrought in God.
hmr: Amiruokchu tûkhawm a thaw dik phawt chu, an thilthawhai Pathien leia thaw an ni ti ân langna dingin, varah an hung hlak,” a ta.

en: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judæa; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.
hmr: Chuong hnunga chun Isu chu a inchûktirhai leh Judai ramah an feh a, chutaka chun Isu an kuomah a um zing a, a baptis hlak a.

en: And John also was baptizing in Ænon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.
hmr: Johan khawmin Ainonah, Salim kâwlah, a baptis bawk a, chutaka chun tui a tam leiin, chun, mi an hung a, baptisma an chang tâwl a.

en: For John was not yet cast into prison.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Johan intâng- na inah an la khum si nawh.

en: There arose therefore a questioning on the part of John’s disciples with a Jew about purifying.
hmr: Chun, Johan inchûktirhai le Juda pakhat inthien dân thuah an lo insêl a.

en: And they came unto John, and said to him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond the Jordan, to whom thou hast borne witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all men come to him.
hmr: Johan kuomah an hung a, a kuomah, “Rabbi, Jordan râla i kuoma um, a thu mi în hriettir khan, ngai ta, kha pa khan mi a baptis a, mi po po a kuomah an hung a nih,” an ta.

en: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it have been given him from heaven.
hmr: Johanin a dawn a, “Mihriemin iengkhawm an nei thei nawh, vâna mi pêk a ni naw chun,

en: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but, that I am sent before him.
hmr: ‘Kei Krista ka ni nawh, a hmaa mi tir ka nih,’ ka ti kha nangni ngei a mi hrietpuitu in nih.

en: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, that standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is made full.
hmr: Moneitu chu a pasal chu a nih; nisienlakhawm, pasal ṭhien ngîr puma a thu hretu chu, pasal râwl leiin a lâwm bêk bêk hlak; hi ka lâwmna a tlung tah a ni hi.

en: He must increase, but I must decrease.
hmr: Ama chu tlatlum ding a nih, kei ruok chu inlâng ding ka nih.

en: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is of the earth, and of the earth he speaketh: he that cometh from heaven is above all.
hmr: “Chung tienga hung chu mi po po nêka chunghnungtak a nih; hnuoia pieng chu hnuoia mi a nih, hnuoi thu a hril hlak, vâna inthawka hung chu mi po po nêka chunghnungtak a nih.

en: What he hath seen and heard, of that he beareth witness; and no man receiveth his witness.
hmr: A hmu le a hriet taphawt ân hriettir hlak a nih; tukhawmin a thu inhriettir an awi nawh.

en: He that hath received his witness hath set his seal to this, that God is true.
hmr: A thu inhriettir awi chun, ‘Pathien chu mi indiktak a nih,’ tiin a hming namin a ziek.

en: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for he giveth not the Spirit by measure.
hmr: Pathien itir chun Pathien thu a hril hlak; ama chu Pathienin inkhi kherin Thlarau a pêk si nawh.

en: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.
hmr: Pa chun Nau a hmangai a, a kutah iengkim a rêngin a pêk tah.

en: He that believeth on the Son hath eternal life; but he that obeyeth not the Son shall not see life, but the wrath of God abideth on him.
hmr: Tûkhawm Nau ring taphawt chun chatuona hringna an nei tah, nisienlakhawm, tûkhawm Nau thu awi naw taphawt chun hringna nei naw hi hai, Pathien lunginsenna an chungah a um zing lem a nih,” a ta.

en: When therefore the Lord knew that the Pharisees had heard that Jesus was making and baptizing more disciples than John
hmr: Chun, Isûn Johan nêkin inchûktir tam lem a siem le a baptis ti Pharisaihaiin an hriet ti Lalpa chun a hriet phingleh,

en: (although Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples),
hmr: (nisienlakhawm, Isu meu chun a baptis nawh a, a închûktirhaiin an baptis lem hlak),

en: he left Judæa, and departed again into Galilee.
hmr: Judai ram chu a fe san a, Galili ramah a fe tah a.

en: And he must needs pass through Samaria.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari ram a fe thleng ding a na.

en: So he cometh to a city of Samaria, called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph:
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari ram khaw pakhat, Sukar an ti chu a hung tlung a, Jakobin a nau Josef kuoma hmun a ipêk kâwl kha.

en: and Jacob’s well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus by the well. It was about the sixth hour.
hmr: Jakob tuisunsuo khawm kha chutaka chun a um. Chuongchun, Isu chu a fe sâwl leiin tuisunsuo sîra chun a ṭhung chawt a; sûn bufâk pha a nih.

en: There cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give me to drink.
hmr: Samari nuhmei pakhat tui chawi dingin a hung a, Isûn a kuomah, “Dâwn ding mi pe rawh,” a ta.

en: For his disciples were gone away into the city to buy food.
hmr: (A închûktirhai hlak chu fâk ding inchaw dingin khuoah an fe ta sih a.)

en: The Samaritan woman therefore saith unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, who am a Samaritan woman? (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Nang Juda mi i na, kei Samari nuhmei ka ni sih a, iengtizie am a na, ka kuoma dâwn ding i hnih?” a ta. (Judahaiin Samari mihai ieng khawm an inṭâwmpui ngai si nawh.)

en: Jesus answered and said unto her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is that saith to thee, Give me to drink; thou wouldest have asked of him, and he would have given thee living water.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Pathien thilpêk le, ‘Dâwn ding mi pe rawh,’ i kuoma titu hi hre la chu nangin a kuomah i hni lem ding a nih; chun, ama chun tui hring a pêk ding che a nih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: whence then hast thou that living water?
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, khaina iengkhawm i nei si nawh a, tuisunsuo ân thûk vei leh, khâwlaia inthawkin am tui hring chu i hmuh a?

en: Art thou greater than our father Jacob, who gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his sons, and his cattle?
hmr: Kan pu Jakob nêkin i ropui lem am a nih? Ama chun hi tuisunsuo hi a mi pêk a, ama khawmin a dâwn a, a nauhai le a ranhai leh,” a ta.

en: Jesus answered and said unto her, Every one that drinketh of this water shall thirst again:
hmr: Chun, Isûn a dawn a, a kuomah, “Tûkhawm hi tui dâwn taphawt chu an dang châr nâwk a tih;

en: but whosoever drinketh of the water that I shall give him shall never thirst; but the water that I shall give him shall become in him a well of water springing up unto eternal life.
hmr: tûkhawm an kuoma ka pêk ding tui dâwn taphawt ruok chu, kum- khuoin dangchâr naw ni hai, keiin an kuoma tui ka pêk ding chu, an sûngah tuihnâr hung um a ta, chatuona hringna chenin inchik dawk a tih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come all the way hither to draw.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, chu tui chu mi pe rawh, ka dangchâr nawna ding le hi chen chena tui chawi dinga ka hung nawna dingin,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Go, call thy husband, and come hither.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “I pasal va ko la, hitakah hung nâwk rawh,” a ta.

en: The woman answered and said unto him, I have no husband. Jesus saith unto her, Thou saidst well, I have no husband:
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pasal ka nei le,” a ta, a dawn a. Isûn a kuomah, “Pasal ka nei le, i ti hi i ti dik ie;

en: for thou hast had five husbands; and he whom thou now hast is not thy husband: this hast thou said truly.
hmr: pasal panga i nei tah, tuta mi i nei hi i pasal a ni naw hrim a nih, hi thu hi i ti dik ie,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
hmr: Nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Pu, zâwlnei i nih ti ka hriet tah.

en: Our fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
hmr: Keini thlatuhai chun hi tlânga hin Pathien chibai an bûk hlak; nisienlakhawm, nangni chun, ‘Mihriemin Pathien chibai an bûkna hmun ding chu Jerusalemah a um,’ in ti hlak,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, Woman, believe me, the hour cometh, when neither in this mountain, nor in Jerusalem, shall ye worship the Father.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Nu- hmei, ka thu awi rawh, hi tlânga kher naw khawm, Jerusalema kher naw khawm, Pathien chibai in bûk hun a tlung ding a ni tah.

en: Ye worship that which ye know not: we worship that which we know; for salvation is from the Jews.
hmr: Nangnîn in hriet naw chibai in bûk hlak, keini chun chu kan ihriet chu chibai kan bûk hlak. Sandamna Judahaia inthawkin a hung suok ding a ni sih a.

en: But the hour cometh, and now is, when the true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth: for such doth the Father seek to be his worshippers.
hmr: Chuongchun, a hun a tlung ding a ni tah, tu khawm hin a tlung zing tah, chu pha chun Pathien chibai bûktu taktakhaiin thlarau le titaktakin Pa chibai bûk an tih, Pa chun chuong ang mi chu ama chibai bûktu dingin a zawng a nih.

en: God is a Spirit: and they that worship him must worship in spirit and truth.
hmr: Pathien chu Thlarau a nih; ama chibai bûktuhaiin thlarau le titak- takin chibai an bûk ding a nih,” a ta.

en: The woman saith unto him, I know that Messiah cometh (he that is called Christ): when he is come, he will declare unto us all things.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a kuomah, “Messie, Krista an ti chu a hung ding a nih ti ka hriet a, ama chu a hung phaleh iengkim mi la hril a tih,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto her, I that speak unto thee am he.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Kei a betu che hi ama chu ka ni annâwm,” a ta.

en: And upon this came his disciples; and they marvelled that he was speaking with a woman; yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why speakest thou with her?
hmr: Chuong lai chun a închûktirhai chu an hung a, nuhmei a biek chu mak an ti hleh a; nisienlakhawm, tukhawmin, “Ieng am i zawng? Ieng- dinga nuhmei i biek am?” khawm an ti nawh.

en: So the woman left her waterpot, and went away into the city, and saith to the people,
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun a tuibêl a mâksan a, khuoah a feh a, mihai kuomah,

en: Come, see a man, who told me all things that ever I did: can this be the Christ?
hmr: “Ka thilthaw taphawt mi hril peitu mi pakhat a um a, hung unla, en ta u, Krista a ni thei âwm am?” a ta.

en: They went out of the city, and were coming to him.
hmr: Chun, anni chu khuoa inthawk chun an hung suok a, a kuom tieng an pan tah a.

en: In the mean while the disciples prayed him, saying, Rabbi, eat.
hmr: Chu kâr chun inchûktirhai chun a kuomah, “Inchûktirtu, fa rawh,” an lo ti an lo tih a.

en: But he said unto them, I have meat to eat that ye know not.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun an kuomah, “Bu in hriet naw fâk ding ka nei,” a ta.

en: The disciples therefore said one to another, Hath any man brought him aught to eat?
hmr: Chun, inchûktirhai chu an inbiek a, “A fâk ding miin an hung chawipêk am a ni aw,” an in tih a.

en: Jesus saith unto them, My meat is to do the will of him that sent me, and to accomplish his work.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah a hril a, “A mi tirtu dit zâwng thaw le, a sin thaw zo ding hi ka bu a nih.

en: Say not ye, There are yet four months, and then cometh the harvest? behold, I say unto you, Lift up your eyes, and look on the fields, that they are white already unto harvest.
hmr: Nangnîn, ‘Bu sîkna ding thla li a la um,’ in ti a ni naw am a ni? Ngai ro, ka hril cheu hi, dâk unla, lohai en ro, tuta inthawkin sîk dingin a hmin a nih.

en: He that reapeth receiveth wages, and gathereth fruit unto life eternal; that he that soweth and he that reapeth may rejoice together.
hmr: A sîktu chun hlaw a hmu hlak a, chatuona hringna chena um dingin ra a sîk hlak, a tutu le a sîktu an lâwm rêl theina dingin.

en: For herein is the saying true, One soweth, and another reapeth.
hmr: ‘Pakhatin a tuh a, mi dangin a sîk hlak,’ ti thu hi, chutaka chun ân dik hle a nih.

en: I sent you to reap that whereon ye have not labored: others have labored, and ye are entered into their labor.
hmr: In inrimpui naw sîk dingin ka tir cheu hi; mi dangin a thawh a, nangnîn a thawsa chu in sunzawm a nih,” a ta.

en: And from that city many of the Samaritans believed on him because of the word of the woman, who testified, He told me all things that ever I did.
hmr: Chun, nuhmei chun, “Ka thil- thaw po a mi hril pei,” tia ân hriet- tirna thu lei khan, chu khuoa um Samari mi tamtakin Isu an ring tah a.

en: So when the Samaritans came unto him, they besought him to abide with them: and he abode there two days.
hmr: Chuongchun, Samari mihai chu Isu kuomah an hung a, an kuoma um dingin an ngên an ngên a; chuongchun, chutaka chun ni hni a châm a.

en: And many more believed because of his word;
hmr: Chun, mi dang tamtakin ama thu leiin an ring ve tah a.

en: and they said to the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy speaking: for we have heard for ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Saviour of the world.
hmr: Chun, anni chun, nuhmei kuoma chun, “Tu zet hin chu i thu hril leia ring kan ni ta nawh; keini ngeiin a thu hril kan hriet tah a, hi mipa hi khawvêl Sandamtu a ni ngei ti kan hriet tah,” an ta.

en: And after the two days he went forth from thence into Galilee.
hmr: Chun, chu ni hni hnunga chun chutaka inthawkin a suok a, Galili ramah a fe tah a.

en: For Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honor in his own country.
hmr: Isu ngeiin, zâwlnei chu ama khuo tieng chun chawimawiin a um ngai nawh ti ân hriettir hlak sih a.

en: So when he came into Galilee, the Galilæans received him, having seen all the things that he did in Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
hmr: Chuongchun, Galili ram a hung tlungin Galili rama mihaiin an lo lâwm a, Jerusalema ruoiṭhe laia a thilthaw po po an hmu lei khan; anni khawm chu ruoiṭhenaa chun an fe ve sih a.

en: He came therefore again unto Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
hmr: Chun, Galili rama Kana khuo, tui uoina ân changtirna kha a hung tlung nâwk a. Chun, upa tû amanih a um a, a naupa Kapernaumah a damnawh a.

en: When he heard that Jesus was come out of Judæa into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son; for he was at the point of death.
hmr: Chun, Isu Judai rama in- thawkin Galili ramah a hung ti a hriet phingleh a hang feh a, a naupa zu sukdam dingin a ngên a, a thi vâng vâng sih a.

en: Jesus therefore said unto him, Except ye see signs and wonders, ye will in no wise believe.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Inchiknahai le thilmakhai in hmu naw chun ring tawp naw ti niu,” a ta.

en: The nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
hmr: Chun, upa chun a kuomah, “Pu, ka nau thi hmain hung thla ta la,” a ta.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Go thy way; thy son liveth. The man believed the word that Jesus spake unto him, and he went his way.
hmr: Isûn a kuomah, “Fe nâwk el ta rawh, i naupa chu a dam tah ie,” a ta. Ama chun Isûn a kuoma thu a hril chu a ring a, a fe tah a.

en: And as he was now going down, his servants met him, saying, that his son lived.
hmr: Chun, a fe thlâk lai zingin a suokhaiin ama an lo tuok a, “I naupa chu a dam tah,” an lo tih a.

en: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to amend. They said therefore unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah a dam phut hun lai ân dawn a. Anni chun a kuomah, “Zâni nisa inhêm chau khan a khawsik a bo tah a nih,” an ta.

en: So the father knew that it was at that hour in which Jesus said unto him, Thy son liveth: and himself believed, and his whole house.
hmr: Chuongchun, a pain Isûn a kuoma, “I naupa chu a dam tah ie,” a ti lai tak chu a nih, ti a hriet tah a; chun, ama le a sûnghaiin an rêngin an ring tah a.

en: This is again the second sign that Jesus did, having come out of Judæa into Galilee.
hmr: Chu chu Isu thilmak a thaw vawi hnina a nih, Judai rama inthawka Galili rama a hungin.

en: After these things there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
hmr: Chuong thil hnunga chun Judahai ruoiṭhe pakhat a um a; Isu Jerusalemah a hang feh a.

en: Now there is in Jerusalem by the sheep gate a pool, which is called in Hebrew Bethesda, having five porches.
hmr: Chun, Jerusalema chun berâm kawtkhâr kâwlah dîl a um a, chu chu Hebrai ṭawngin Bethesda an tih a, tuolpûk panga a nei a.

en: In these lay a multitude of them that were sick, blind, halt, withered.
hmr: Chuonga chun damnawhai, mitdelhai, ke inbaihai, zenghai tamtak an zâl tâwl a, [tui infâwn hun an nghâk a.
Akâr po leh dîla chun vântirko a zu feh a, tui chu a sukfâwn hlak a; mi tukhawm ieng ang natna nei khawm ni hai sien, tuifâwn zu pal hmasatak taphawt chu an dam pei hlak sih a.]

en: And a certain man was there, who had been thirty and eight years in his infirmity.
hmr: Chutaka chun, kum sâwm thum pariet natna nei mi tu amanih a um a.

en: When Jesus saw him lying, and knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he saith unto him, Wouldest thou be made whole?
hmr: Isûn a zâl chu a hmuh a, chuong ang chun sâwttak a um tah ti a hriet a, a kuomah, “Sukdam i nuom am?” a ta.

en: The sick man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.
hmr: Chun, damnaw chun, “Pu, tui a hung fâwn pha dîla mi sietu ding ka nei nawh a, ka fe sûngin mi dangin an mi fe khêl nâwk hlak,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: Jesus saith unto him, Arise, take up thy bed, and walk.
hmr: Chun, Isûn a kuomah, “Tho la, i puonpha la la, kein lâwn ta rawh,” a ta.

en: And straightway the man was made whole, and took up his bed and walked. Now it was the sabbath on that day.
hmr: Chun, kârloin ama chu a dam nghâl tah a, a puonpha a lâk a, a fe tah a. Chu ni chu Châwlni a na.

en: So the Jews said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath, and it is not lawful for thee to take up thy bed.
hmr: Chuongchun, Judahaiin suk- dama um kuoma chun, “Châwlni a ni hi, i puonpha i lâk a thieng nawh ie,” an ta.

en: But he answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take up thy bed, and walk.
hmr: Ama chun an kuomah, “A mi sukdamtu ngeiin ka kuomah, ‘I puonpha la la, kein lâwn ta rawh,’ a mi ti a nih,” a ta, a dawn a.

en: They asked him, Who is the man that said unto thee, Take up thy bed, and walk?
hmr: Anni chun a kuomah, “ ‘I puon- pha la la, kein lâwn ta rawh,’ titu che chu tu am a na?” an tih a, an indawn a.

en: But he that was healed knew not who it was; for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in the place.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, sukdama um chun tû a ni a hriet nawh a, chutaka chun mipui an um leiin Isu a fe hmang ta sih a.

en: Afterward Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold, thou art made whole: sin no more, lest a worse thing befall thee.
hmr: A nakie chun ama chu Isûn Pathien biekinah a hmuh a, a kuomah, “Ngai rawh, i dam ta hi, thil suksuol nâwk ta naw rawh, chuong- naw chun, thil ṭha naw nâwk zuol i chungah hung um rawi a tih,” a ta.

en: The man went away, and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him whole.
hmr: Chun, ama chu a va feh a, Judahai kuoma chun, ama sukdamtu chu Isu a nih ti a hril a.

en: And for this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, because he did these things on the sabbath.
hmr: Chuongchun, Châwlnia chuong thilhai chu a thaw leiin Judahaiin Isu an suknawmna tah a.

en: But Jesus answered them, My Father worketh even until now, and I work.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Isûn anni chu a biek a, an kuomah, “Ka Pain tu chen khawmin sin a thaw hlak, kei khawmin ka thaw hlak,” a ta.

en: For this cause therefore the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only brake the sabbath, but also called God his own Father, making himself equal with God.
hmr: Chun, Judahaiin sukhlum an tum nâwk zuol a, Châwlni a bawsiet lei chau khawm a ni nawh a, Pathien ama paah ân bûk a, Pathien tluka ân siem lei khawmin a nih.

en: Jesus therefore answered and said unto them, Verily, verily, I say unto you, The Son can do nothing of himself, but what he seeth the Father doing: for what things soever he doeth, these the Son also doeth in like manner.
hmr: Chun, Isûn an kuomah, “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, Naupa hin a khâtin iengkhawm a thaw thei nawh, Pa thilthaw a hmu chau naw chu; thil a thaw ang taphawt chu Naupa khawmin a thaw ve hlak.

en: For the Father loveth the Son, and showeth him all things that himself doeth: and greater works than these will he show him, that ye may marvel.
hmr: Pain Naupa a hmangai a, a thilthaw taphawt a kuomah ân entir hlak; hieng nêka thil ropui lem hi a kuomah lân entir a tih, mak in ti dingin.

en: For as the Father raiseth the dead and giveth them life, even so the Son also giveth life to whom he will.
hmr: Pain mithihai a keithoa a sukhring hlak angin, Naupa khawm- in a nuom nuom a sukhring hlak.

en: For neither doth the Father judge any man, but he hath given all judgment unto the Son;
hmr: Pain tû thu khawm a rêlpêk ngai nawh, thu po po Naupa ân rêltir lem a;

en: that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He that honoreth not the Son honoreth not the Father that sent him.
hmr: mi po poin Pa an inza angin Naupa khawm an inzana dingin. Tûkhawm Naupa inza naw chu Pa, ama tirtu inza naw a nih.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, He that heareth my word, and believeth him that sent me, hath eternal life, and cometh not into judgment, but hath passed out of death into life.
hmr: “Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, tûkhawm ka thu hrea a mi tirtu ring chun chatuona hringna a nei tah, inthiemloin a um nawh a, thinaa inthawkin a suok a, hringnaah a lût lem tah a nih.

en: Verily, verily, I say unto you, The hour cometh, and now is, when the dead shall hear the voice of the Son of God; and they that hear shall live.
hmr: Titakzetin, titakzetin ka hril cheu hi, a hun a tlung ding a ni tah, tu khawm hin a tlung zing tah, chu pha chun mithihaiin Pathien Naupa râwl hrieng an ta, a hre taphawt hring an tih.

en: For as the Father hath life in himself, even so gave he to the Son also to have life in himself:
hmr: Pa chun mânia hringna a nei ang bawkin, Naupa mânia hringna neiin a siem;

en: and he gave him authority to execute judgment, because he is a son of man.
hmr: chun, Mihriem Naupa a ni leiin a kuomah rorêl ding thu a pêk.

en: Marvel not at this: for the hour cometh, in which all that are in the tombs shall hear his voice,
hmr: Hieng hi mak ti naw ro, a hun a tlung ding a ni tah, chu pha chun thlâna um po poin a râwl hrieng an ta,

en: and shall come forth; they that have done good, unto the resurrection of life; and they that have done evil, unto the resurrection of judgment.
hmr: suok vawng an tih; thil ṭha thawtuhai chu hringna changin tho nâwk an ta, thil suol thawtuhai chu inthiemnawna changin tho nâwk an tih.

en: I can of myself do nothing: as I hear, I judge: and my judgment is righteous; because I seek not mine own will, but the will of him that sent me.
hmr: “Keia khâtin iengkhawm ka thaw thei nawh; naa ka hriet ang peiin ro ka rêl hlak; ka rorêl chu indiktak a nih, keia thu thuin um ka tum nawh a, a mi tirtu thu thua um ka tum lem hlak leiin.

en: If I bear witness of myself, my witness is not true.
hmr: Mâni chanchin inhriettir lang, ka thu inhriettir indik naw ni.

en: It is another that beareth witness of me; and I know that the witness which he witnesseth of me is true.
hmr: Ka chanchin inhriettirtu chu mi dang a nih; ama chun ka chanchin ân hriettir chu ân dik ti ka hriet.

en: Ye have sent unto John, and he hath borne witness unto the truth.
hmr: “Nangnîn Johan kuomah mi in tir a, ama chun, thutak chanchin a lo inhriettir kha;

en: But the witness which I receive is not from man: howbeit I say these things, that ye may be saved.
hmr: Thu inhriettir ka ipawm ruok chu mihriem thu a ni nawh, nisien- lakhawm, in damna dingin hieng thu hi ka hril a ni hi.

en: He was the lamp that burneth and shineth; and ye were willing to rejoice for a season in his light.
hmr: Chu Johan chu khâwnvar chawktak le var tak a nih, a varah lân sukhlim in nuom kha.

en: But the witness which I have is greater than that of John; for the works which the Father hath given me to accomplish, the very works that I do, bear witness of me, that the Father hath sent me.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, inhriettirna ka nei hi Johan inhriettirna nêk khan a ropui lem a nih; Pain thil thaw zo dinga a mi pêk, ka thilthaw ngei hin Pain a mi tir a ni ti ka chanchin ân hriettir a nih.

en: And the Father that sent me, he hath borne witness of me. Ye have neither heard his voice at any time, nor seen his form.
hmr: Pa a mi tirtu khawm chun ka chanchin ân hriettir tah. Nangnîn iengtik khawm a râwl in hriet ngai nawh, a hmêl khawm in hmu ngai nawh.

en: And ye have not his word abiding in you: for whom he sent, him ye believe not.
hmr: A thu khawm in lungrilah in pai zing ngai nawh; a itir hi in ring naw leiin.

en: Ye search the scriptures, because ye think that in them ye have eternal life; and these are they which bear witness of me;
hmr: Pathien Lekha in tiem ngun hlak a, a sûnga chatuona hringna um dinga in ring leiin; chuong Lekha chu ka chanchin inhriettirna chu a ni sih a.

en: and ye will not come to me, that ye may have life.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, hringna nei dingin ka kuomah in hung nuom si nawh.

en: I receive not glory from men.
hmr: “Mihriem ichawimawina ka pawm nawh.

en: But I know you, that ye have not the love of God in yourselves.
hmr: Nangni ka hriet cheu, Pathien hmangaina in lungrilah in nei nawh ie.

en: I am come in my Father’s name, and ye receive me not: if another shall come in his own name, him ye will receive.
hmr: Ka Pa hmingin ka hung a, nangnîn in mi lâwm si nawh; mi dang mâni hmingin hung sienla, ama chu lâwm in tih.

en: How can ye believe, who receive glory one of another, and the glory that cometh from the only God ye seek not?
hmr: “Nangni inchawimawituo lâwm- hai, iengtin am ring thei in ta? Pathien tak chaua suok chawi- mawina chu in zawng si nawh.

en: Think not that I will accuse you to the Father: there is one that accuseth you, even Moses, on whom ye have set your hope.
hmr: Keiin Pa kuoma ka hêk cheu ring naw ro, nangni hêktu cheu chu pakhat a um, in iring Mosie hi.

en: For if ye believed Moses, ye would believe me; for he wrote of me.
hmr: Mosie in ring chun, kei khawm mi ring ta ding in nih; ama chun keia chanchin in sawnnaw a ziek.
